中文: 這支隊伍連贏了五場比賽，創下了新紀錄。

句子: After two consecutive days of rain, the sun finally came out
中文: 連續兩天的降雨之後，太陽終於露臉了。

句子: The committee reached a consensus on the new policy changes after extensive discussions
中文: 經過廣泛討論後，委員會就新的政策變更達成了共識。

句子: There was a general consensus among the voters that the new candidate was the best choice
中文: 選民之間普遍達成共識，認為這位新候選人是最佳選擇。

句子: The board achieved a consensus on the budget proposal, with all members agreeing on the final numbers
中文: 董事會在預算提案上達成共識，所有成員都同意最終的數字。

句子: The decision was made by consensus
中文: 這項決策是經由共識作出的。

句子: The parents gave their consent for the child to participate in the field trip
中文: 家長同意讓孩子參加校外教學。

句子: Written consent is required before conducting the medical procedure
中文: 進行醫療程序前需要書面同意。

句子: The agreement was valid only after receiving consent from all parties involved
中文: 該協議在收到所有相關方的同意後才有效。

句子: She consented to the terms of the contract after reviewing them thoroughly
中文: 她在仔細審閱合同條款後同意了這些條件。

句子: The patient consented to the surgery after discussing the risks with the doctor
中文: 病人在與醫生討論風險後同意進行手術。

句子: They consented to the changes in the project plan
中文: 他們同意對項目計劃進行變更。

句子: A good design consists in balancing aesthetics, functionality, and user experience seamlessly
中文: 好的設計在於無縫平衡美學、功能性和使用者體驗。

句子: Happiness consists in being satisfied with what you have
中文: 幸福在於滿足於你所擁有的。

句子: His success consists in his dedication and hard work
中文: 他的成功在於他的奉獻和努力工作。

句子: A design studio consists of talented designers, skilled mechanical engineers, and experienced project managers
中文: 一間設計工作室由才華洋溢的設計師、熟練的機械工程師和經驗豐富的項目經理組成。

句子: Breakfast consisted of cereal, fruit, and orange juice
中文: 早餐包括麥片、水果和橙汁。

句子: The committee consists of seven members
中文: 委員會由七名成員組成。

句子: The crowd consisted mainly of teenage girls
中文: 人群主要由少女組成。

句子: The teacher values consistency in student effort and work ethic
中文: 老師重視學生在努力和工作態度上的一致性。

句子: Her consistency in delivering high-quality results impressed her supervisors
中文: 她在提供高品質成果上的一致性給她的主管留下了深刻印象。

句子: There is no consistency between the movie and the book
中文: 電影與書本之間缺乏一致性。

句子: The consistency of the sauce was too thick, so I added more water
中文: 醬料的濃稠度太厚，所以我加了更多水。

句子: The consistency of the batter needs to be smooth before baking
中文: 在烘焙前，麵糊的濃稠度需要平滑。

句子: She mixed the dough to the right consistency
中文: 她將麵團攪拌到適當的濃稠度。

句子: Her consistent performance in every project earned her the reputation of being reliable and effective
中文: 她在每個項目中一致的表現為她贏得了可靠且高效的聲譽。

句子: Customers expect that the quality of service they receive will be consistent
中文: 顧客期望他們所接受的服務品質能夠保持一致。

句子: Her actions were consistent with her stated goals and values
中文: 她的行動與她所陳述的目標和價值觀一致。

句子: The artist's paintings are consistent in their use of vibrant colors and bold strokes
中文: 這位藝術家的畫作在運用鮮豔色彩和大膽筆觸上保持一致。

句子: The product line is consistent in its sleek design and user-friendly features, making it instantly recognizable to customers
中文: 該產品線在時尚設計和使用者友善功能上保持一致，使其立即為顧客所辨識。

句子: The investigation revealed a conspiracy to commit fraud within the company
中文: 調查揭露了公司內部存在一個共謀詐欺的陰謀。

句子: The two leaders were accused of conspiracy to overthrow the government
中文: 這兩位領導人被指控共謀推翻政府。

句子: There was widespread speculation about a conspiracy behind the sudden market collapse
中文: 人們普遍猜測市場突然崩潰背後存在一個陰謀。

句子: The group was arrested for conspiracy to commit bank robbery after their elaborate plan was uncovered by authorities
中文: 該團體因策劃搶劫銀行的陰謀被當局揭露其精心計劃後被逮捕。

句子: The whistleblower exposed a conspiracy within the company to cover up safety violations in their products
中文: 吹哨者揭露了公司內部一個掩蓋產品安全違規的陰謀。

句子: The construction site for the new shopping mall spans several acres
中文: 新購物中心的建築工地橫跨數英畝。

句子: Heavy machinery is being operated on the construction site daily
中文: 重型機械每天在建築工地上運作。

句子: Workers must wear protective gear while on the construction site
中文: 工人在建築工地上必須穿戴防護裝備。

句子: The construction site was fenced off to ensure public safety
中文: 建築工地被圍起來以確保公眾安全。

句子: I'll do nothing without consulting you
中文: 我不會在沒有請教你的情況下做任何事。

句子: She consulted her doctor before starting the new medication
中文: 她在開始使用新藥物前諮詢了她的醫生。

句子: The company consulted with a financial advisor to plan their investment strategy
中文: 公司與財務顧問諮詢以規劃他們的投資策略。

句子: He consulted various sources before writing his research paper
中文: 他在撰寫研究論文前查閱了多種來源。

句子: The retired executive consults for several large companies
中文: 這位退休的高管為幾家大公司提供諮詢。

句子: Please consult the manual if you have questions about the machine
中文: 如果你對機器有疑問，請查閱手冊。

句子: The historian consulted ancient texts for accurate information
中文: 歷史學家查閱古代文本以獲取準確資訊。

句子: The company hired a consultant to help improve their marketing strategy
中文: 公司聘請了一位顧問來幫助改進他們的行銷策略。

句子: As a financial consultant, she advises clients on investment opportunities
中文: 作為一名財務顧問，她為客戶提供投資機會的建議。

句子: The consultant provided valuable insights into the company’s operational inefficiencies
中文: 顧問為公司的運營效率低下提供了寶貴的見解。

句子: Doctor Smith is a consultant in cardiology at the local hospital
中文: 史密斯醫生是當地醫院的心臟病學顧問。

句子: The consultant was called in to provide a second opinion on the complex case
中文: 顧問被請來為這個複雜案例提供第二意見。

句子: The air conditioner has very high energy consumption
中文: 這台冷氣機的能源消耗非常高。

句子: Water consumption tends to rise during the summer months
中文: 夏季期間的用水量往往會上升。

句子: The consumption of fruits and vegetables is beneficial for health
中文: 食用蔬果有益於健康。

句子: Excessive sugar consumption can lead to health problems
中文: 過量攝取糖分可能導致健康問題。

句子: As income increases, people's consumption also rises
中文: 隨著收入增加，人們的消費也隨之上升。

句子: Online shopping has significantly boosted global consumption rates
中文: 線上購物顯著提升了全球消費率。

句子: The box contains all the necessary tools for the project
中文: 這個盒子裡裝有項目所需的所有工具。

句子: The bottle contains water, not juice
中文: 這個瓶子裡裝的是水，不是果汁。

句子: The fire was contained before it spread to nearby buildings
中文: 火勢在蔓延到附近建築物之前已被控制住。

句子: She struggled to contain her excitement when she heard the news
中文: 她聽到這個消息時，難以抑制自己的興奮。

句子: The report contains valuable information about market trends
中文: 這份報告包含了有關市場趨勢的寶貴資訊。

句子: The book contains several interesting essays on modern art
中文: 這本書包含了幾篇關於現代藝術的有趣文章。

句子: She sat by the window to contemplate her future and the decisions she needed to make
中文: 她坐在窗邊，思索自己的未來以及需要做出的決定。

句子: He contemplated the meaning of life during his long walk in the park
中文: 他在公園長時間散步時，思考生命的意義。

句子: After much contemplation, they decided to move to a new city for a fresh start
中文: 經過深思熟慮後，他們決定搬到一個新城市重新開始。

句子: He began to contemplate committing suicide but reached out for help instead
中文: 他開始考慮自殺，但最終選擇尋求幫助。

句子: The artist contemplated the landscape before starting her painting
中文: 這位藝術家在開始繪畫前，先靜靜地凝視著風景。

句子: He contemplated the stars, lost in their beauty and mystery
中文: 他凝視著星星，沉浸在它們的美麗與神秘之中。

句子: She contemplated the sculpture, trying to understand the artist's vision
中文: 她凝視著雕塑，試圖理解藝術家的創作意圖。

句子: After much contemplation, she decided to change her career path
中文: 經過深思熟慮後，她決定改變自己的職業道路。

句子: The philosopher’s contemplation of existence led to profound insights
中文: 這位哲學家對存在的沉思帶來了深刻的洞見。

句子: He engaged in the contemplation of the meaning of life, seeking answers to existential questions
中文: 他沉浸於對生命意義的思索，尋求存在問題的答案。

句子: He spent hours in contemplation at the quiet lakeside
中文: 他在寧靜的湖邊花了好幾個小時沉思。

句子: The retreat provided a perfect setting for contemplation and personal growth
中文: 這個靜修處提供了一個完美的環境，讓人沉思與個人成長。

句子: Contemporary architecture challenges traditional forms, creating bold and innovative designs.
中文: 當代建築挑戰傳統形式，創造出大膽且創新的設計。

句子: Every contemporary artist builds upon the past to create something new.
中文: 每位當代藝術家都在過去的基礎上創造新的事物。

句子: Contemporary issues require modern solutions driven by education and awareness.
中文: 當代問題需要以教育與認知為基礎的現代解決方案。

句子: Contemporary art often blends traditional techniques with modern technology
中文: (當代藝術經常將傳統技術與現代科技相結合。)

句子: The novel's themes are still relevant to contemporary society
中文: (這部小說的主題在當代社會中仍然具有相關性)

句子: He is known for his contemporary style of architecture, which combines innovation with sustainability
中文: (他以其融合創新與永續的當代建築風格聞名)

句子: Shakespeare and Cervantes were contemporaries, both living during the 16th century
中文: (莎士比亞和塞萬提斯是同時代的人，兩人都生活在16世紀)

句子: She found inspiration in the work of her contemporaries in the art world
中文: (她從藝術界同時代人的作品中找到了靈感)

句子: The room had a contemporary touch, with sleek furniture and bold, modern artwork on the walls
中文: (這個房間帶有當代風格，配有時尚的家具和牆上大膽現代的藝術品。)

句子: She added a contemporary touch to the vintage furniture by reupholstering it with a bright, modern fabric
中文: (她通過用明亮、現代的布料重新包覆老式家具，為其增添了當代風格。)

句子: Her fashion designs incorporate a contemporary touch, making the overall look both modern and creative
中文: (她的時尚設計融入了當代風格，使整體造型既現代又富有創意。)

句子: He spoke with contempt about those who disagreed with him
中文: 他對那些與他意見不合的人表現出蔑視。

句子: The judge warned the lawyer against showing contempt for the court
中文: 法官警告律師不要對法庭表示蔑視。

句子: He was fined for contempt of court after interrupting the proceedings
中文: 他因打斷庭審程序而被處以藐視法庭的罰款。

句子: The journalist risked contempt charges by refusing to reveal her source
中文: 這位記者因拒絕透露消息來源而冒著藐視法庭指控的風險。

句子: The content of the presentation was very engaging
中文: 簡報的內容非常引人入勝。

句子: The toys contented the children, at least for a little while
中文: 這些玩具讓孩子們感到滿足，至少暫時是如此。

句子: The rainy weather spoiled our plans for the beach, so we had to content ourselves with a relaxing day at home
中文: 雨天打亂了我們去海灘的計劃，所以我們只好在家裡放鬆一天來滿足自己。

句子: A fancy hotel is not necessary; I'd be content with a warm meal and a clean place to sleep
中文: 我不需要豪華的飯店；只要有一頓熱騰騰的飯和一個乾淨的地方可以睡覺，我就很滿足了。

句子: Please review the content of the email before sending it
中文: 請在發送前審查電子郵件的內容。

句子: The children aren't allowed to watch movies with violent content
中文: 孩子們不被允許觀看含有暴力內容的電影。

句子: This beer is low in alcohol content
中文: 這種啤酒的酒精含量很低。

句子: The fat content of the food was high
中文: 這食物的脂肪含量很高。

句子: He'd finished his dinner and now there was a look of perfect content on his face
中文: 他吃完晚餐後，臉上露出一種完全滿足的神情。[or contentment]

句子: She found content in the simple pleasures of life
中文: 她在生活中的簡單樂趣中找到了滿足。

句子: The baby looks content in her crib
中文: 那個嬰兒在她的嬰兒床裡看起來很安詳滿足。

句子: A fancy hotel is not necessary; I would be content with a warm meal and a clean place to sleep
中文: 高級飯店並不是必需的；只要有一頓熱騰騰的飯和一個乾淨的睡覺地方，我就很滿足了。

句子: The company’s content marketing strategy includes blogs, videos, and social media posts to engage potential customers
中文: 該公司的內容行銷策略包括部落格、影片和社群媒體貼文，以吸引潛在客戶。

句子: By providing educational articles and tutorials, the brand's content marketing helps establish it as an authority in its field
中文: 透過提供教育性文章和教學指南，該品牌的內容行銷有助於將其建立為該領域的權威。

句子: She found contentment in the simple pleasures of daily life
中文: 她在日常生活中的簡單樂趣中找到了滿足感。

句子: His contentment was evident as he sat quietly by the fire after a long day
中文: 經過一整天的辛勞，他靜靜地坐在火爐旁，滿足之情溢於言表。

句子: Many people strive for contentment, but few find it
中文: 許多人追求內心的滿足，但真正找到的人卻不多。

句子: The contract is contingent on the completion of the project
中文: 合約取決於專案的完成情況。

句子: Their participation in the event is contingent upon receiving funding
中文: 他們是否參加該活動取決於是否獲得資金支持。

句子: The success of the experiment was contingent on an unforeseen discovery
中文: 實驗的成功依賴於一項出乎意料的發現。

句子: His promotion was contingent upon a series of lucky events
中文: 他的晉升取決於一連串幸運的事件。

句子: A contingent of delegates arrived from neighboring countries for the summit
中文: 一支來自鄰國的代表團抵達參加高峰會。

句子: The school sent a contingent of students to compete in the science fair
中文: 學校派遣了一支學生代表團參加科學展覽競賽。

句子: The company prepared for every possible contingent in their risk assessment
中文: 公司在風險評估中為每一種可能的情況做好了準備。

句子: The continuity of the company’s operations was maintained even during the crisis
中文: 即使在危機期間，公司營運的持續性仍得以維持。

句子: Good storytelling relies on the continuity of plot and character development
中文: 好的故事敘述仰賴情節與角色發展的連貫性。

句子: Historical continuity is important for preserving cultural heritage
中文: 歷史的延續性對於保存文化遺產至關重要。

句子: The continuity of care is essential for effective patient recovery
中文: 照護的連續性對於病患的有效康復至關重要。

句子: The design of the building ensures continuity between the indoor and outdoor spaces, creating a seamless flow
中文: 建築的設計確保了室內與室外空間的連貫性，營造出流暢無縫的動線。

句子: The continuous lines and curves of the smartphone's design make it ergonomic and visually appealing
中文: 智慧型手機設計中的連續線條與曲線使其符合人體工學且具有視覺吸引力。

句子: The continuous integration of sustainable materials throughout the product design reflects the company's commitment to eco-friendly practices
中文: 在產品設計中持續融入永續材料，展現了公司對環保實踐的承諾。

句子: The continuous noise from the construction site made it difficult to concentrate
中文: 來自工地的持續噪音讓人難以集中精神。

句子: The team worked tirelessly through a week of continuous meetings to finalize the project proposal
中文: 團隊不辭辛勞地經過一週的持續會議，終於完成了專案提案。

句子: We experienced a week of continuous rain, which caused flooding in many low-lying areas
中文: 我們經歷了一週的持續降雨，造成許多低窪地區淹水。

句子: The continuous flow of traffic made crossing the street challenging
中文: 持續的車流讓過馬路變得很具挑戰性。

句子: Her actions were completely contrary to her previous statements about environmental conservation
中文: 她的行為與之前關於環境保護的聲明完全相反。

句子: The child was being contrary and refused to eat the dinner that she usually loves
中文: 那個孩子頑固地拒絕吃她平常最愛的晚餐。

句子: You didn't bother me, on the contrary, I like your company
中文: 你並沒有打擾我，恰恰相反，我喜歡你的陪伴。

句子: Cruelty and kindness are contraries
中文: 殘忍與善良是對立的。

句子: The river flows contrary to the direction we expected based on the map
中文: 這條河流的方向與我們根據地圖預期的相反。

句子: Contrary to expectation, he didn't win in the contest
中文: 與預期相反，他在比賽中沒有獲勝。

句子: You didn't bother me, On the contrary, I like your company
中文: 你沒有打擾我，恰恰相反，我喜歡有你陪伴。

句子: Light and shadow create contrast, bringing depth to a painting.
中文: 光與影的對比創造出層次，使畫作更具深度。

句子: The designer contrasted the metallic finish of the stroller's frame with the soft textile of the seat for visual impact
中文: (設計師將嬰兒車框架的金屬質感與座椅的柔軟織物進行對比，以營造視覺衝擊力)

句子: She contrasted the old and new buildings to show how the city had evolved
中文: (她對比了新舊建築，以展示城市是如何演變的)

句子: The contrast between justice and injustice defines our moral responsibility.
中文: 正義與不義的對比界定了我們的道德責任。

句子: The contrast between choices shapes the paths we take in life.
中文: 選擇之間的對比塑造了我們人生的道路。

句子: There is a sharp contrast between the urban and rural lifestyles
中文: (城市與鄉村的生活方式有著鮮明的對比)

句子: The contrast between the dark storm clouds and the bright sunset was striking
中文: (黑暗的暴風雲與明亮的夕陽之間的對比令人印象深刻)

句子: The design of the stroller emphasizes the contrast between the upper frame with its muted metallic color and the lower frame, which features a practical textile-covered basket
中文: (嬰兒車的設計強調了上部框架與其低調的金屬色調和下部框架之間的對比，下部框架配有一個實用的織物覆蓋籃子)

句子: The contrast in textures between the leather seats and the soft fabric cushions was noticeable
中文: (皮革座椅與柔軟織物靠墊之間的質地對比非常明顯)

句子: The artist contrasted light and dark shades to create depth in the painting
中文: (那位藝術家通過對比明暗色調來為畫作創造深度)

句子: The teacher asked the students to contrast the two novels in their essays
中文: (老師要求學生們在文章中對比這兩部小說)

句子: His controversial remarks on social media led to widespread criticism
中文: （他在社群媒體上的爭議性言論引發了廣泛批評）

句子: The new policy was highly controversial, sparking heated debates among the employees
中文: （這項新政策極具爭議，在員工間引發了激烈討論）

句子: Abortion is a highly controversial subject
中文: （墮胎是一個高度具爭議性的話題）

句子: The two rivers converge to form a larger river downstream
中文: （這兩條河流匯聚在一起，在下游形成一條更大的河流）

句子: The roads converge at the city center, making it a convenient meeting point
中文: （這些道路在市中心匯合，使其成為一個便利的會合點）

句子: The discussion on climate change caused experts from various fields to converge at the conference
中文: （關於氣候變遷的討論使來自各領域的專家在會議上匯聚一堂）

句子: The teams' strategies began to converge as they worked on the project together
中文: （隨著他們共同進行該專案，團隊的策略開始趨於一致）

句子: Over time, their viewpoints converged on the best solution to the problem
中文: （隨著時間推移，他們的觀點在該問題的最佳解決方案上趨於一致）

句子: His conversion to Buddhism brought about significant changes in his life
中文: （他皈依佛教為他的生活帶來了重大變化）

句子: She underwent a spiritual conversion after traveling to a religious retreat
中文: （在前往宗教靜修後，她經歷了一次精神上的轉變）

句子: The conversion of inches to centimeters is a common task in measurement
中文: （將英寸轉換為公分是測量中常見的任務）

句子: Energy conversion from solar to electrical power is key to sustainable technology
中文: （將太陽能轉換為電能是永續技術的關鍵）

句子: The company faced charges of conversion after mishandling the client’s funds
中文: （該公司因不當處理客戶資金而面臨侵占罪的指控）

句子: The software supports the conversion of files from PDF to Word
中文: （該軟體支援將檔案從 PDF 轉換為 Word）

句子: Improving the website's design increased the conversion rate of visitors into buyers
中文: （改進網站設計提升了訪客轉換為買家的比率）

句子: Offering a free trial helped boost conversions for the subscription service
中文: （提供免費試用有助於提高訂閱服務的轉換率）

句子: She tried to convey her gratitude through a heartfelt letter
中文: （她試圖透過一封真誠的信來表達她的感激之情）

句子: His tone conveyed a sense of urgency
中文: （他的語氣傳達出一種緊迫感）

句子: The movie conveys a powerful message about kindness
中文: （這部電影傳達了一個關於善良的有力訊息）

句子: The goods were conveyed by truck to the warehouse
中文: （貨物被卡車運送到倉庫）

句子: The pipes convey water to the different areas of the building
中文: （管道將水輸送到建築物的不同區域）

句子: He conveyed his property to his children through a will
中文: （他透過遺囑將財產轉讓給他的子女）

句子: The deed was used to convey the land to the new owner
中文: （該契約用於將土地轉讓給新業主）

句子: The jury reached a conviction after several hours of deliberation
中文: （陪審團經過數小時的審議後做出了定罪判決）

句子: His conviction for theft resulted in a two-year prison sentence
中文: （他因盜竊被判處兩年監禁）

句子: The defendant's previous convictions influenced the judge's sentencing decision
中文: （被告先前的定罪紀錄影響了法官的量刑決定）

句子: Convictions for shoplifting have made it difficult for her to get a job
中文: （因為多次入店行竊的定罪，她很難找到工作）

句子: She spoke with conviction about her beliefs, inspiring others to listen
中文: （她懷著堅定的信念談論自己的信仰，激勵他人傾聽）

句子: His conviction that hard work leads to success motivated him to push through challenges
中文: （他堅信努力工作能帶來成功，這激勵他克服挑戰）

句子: To achieve great things, we must coordinate efforts across different fields.
中文: 要成就偉業，我們必須協調各領域的努力。

句子: The dancers moved in a coordinate manner during the performance
中文: （舞者在表演中以協調的方式移動）

句子: The GPS showed the exact coordinates of the hidden treasure
中文: （GPS 顯示了藏寶的確切座標）

句子: The pilot entered the coordinates to navigate the aircraft
中文: （飛行員輸入座標以導航飛機）

句子: She bought a set of coordinates for her new outfit
中文: （她買了一套相配的服裝）

句子: Scientific discoveries require coordinated teamwork and dedication.
中文: 科學發現需要協調的團隊合作與奉獻。

句子: In warfare, those who coordinate strategy and action emerge victorious.
中文: 在戰爭中，能夠協調戰略與行動的人將取得勝利。

句子: The store sells jackets with matching coordinates
中文: （這家店販售與外套相配的服裝組合）

句子: She coordinated the team’s schedules to avoid conflicts
中文: （她協調了團隊的時間表，以避免衝突）

句子: The wedding planner coordinated every detail of the event
中文: （婚禮策劃師協調了活動的每個細節）

句子: He coordinated his tie with his suit
中文: （他搭配了領帶與西裝）

句子: The colors of the decorations were carefully coordinated
中文: （裝飾的顏色經過精心搭配）

句子: The two departments have coordinate roles in the project
中文: （這兩個部門在該專案中具有協調的角色）

句子: The artist filed a lawsuit against the company for copyright infringement after discovering that her artwork was used without permission
中文: 這位藝術家在發現她的作品未經許可被使用後，對該公司提起了著作權侵權訴訟。

句子: Sharing music files online without the artist's consent is considered copyright infringement
中文: 未經藝術家同意在網上分享音樂檔案被視為著作權侵權。

句子: The publisher was fined for copyright infringement after printing copies of a book without the author’s approval
中文: 該出版商因未經作者批准印刷書籍複本而被罰款，並因此觸犯了著作權侵權法。

句子: The police set up a cordon around the crime scene to keep onlookers away
中文: 警方在犯罪現場周圍設立了警戒線，以防止圍觀者接近。

句子: A cordon of officers surrounded the building during the standoff
中文: 在對峙期間，一圈警察包圍了大樓。

句子: They cordoned off the area to conduct a thorough investigation
中文: 他們封鎖了該區域，以進行徹底調查。

句子: The authorities cordoned the area to prevent anyone from entering during the emergency
中文: 當緊急情況發生時，當局封鎖了該區域，以防止任何人進入。

句子: Emergency services cordoned the site to ensure safety while they worked
中文: 緊急服務人員封鎖了現場，以確保在工作過程中的安全。

句子: Police cordoned off the street during the protest to ensure public safety
中文: 在抗議活動期間，警方封鎖了街道，以確保公共安全。

句子: She started as an intern and gradually climbed the corporate ladder to become the company's CEO
中文: 她從實習生做起，逐步攀升至公司高層，最終成為公司的執行長。

句子: Many employees aspire to move up the corporate ladder, seeking higher salaries and greater influence
中文: 許多員工渴望在職場中晉升，尋求更高的薪水和更大的影響力。

句子: Climbing the corporate ladder often requires a combination of hard work, networking, and strategic career decisions
中文: 爬升職場階梯通常需要努力工作、人脈建立以及策略性的職業決策相結合。

句子: He chose to leave his job, feeling that climbing the corporate ladder was not worth the stress and long hours
中文: 他選擇離開工作，因為覺得爬升職場階梯並不值得那麼多的壓力和長時間的工作。

句子: Her findings correspond with the results of previous studies
中文: 她的研究結果與先前研究的結果相符。

句子: The numbers on the invoice correspond to the purchase order
中文: 發票上的數字與採購訂單相符。

句子: They corresponded for years before meeting in person
中文: 他們在見面之前已經通訊了多年。

句子: The company will correspond with clients through email
中文: 公司將通過電子郵件與客戶進行聯繫。

句子: Each student received a corresponding number for their assigned seat
中文: 每位學生都獲得了對應的座位號碼。

句子: The map uses different colors to indicate corresponding regions
中文: 這張地圖使用不同的顏色來表示對應的區域。

句子: Her promotion came with a corresponding increase in salary
中文: 她的晉升伴隨著相應的薪水增加。

句子: The results of the experiment were compared with the corresponding data from last year
中文: 實驗結果與去年的相應數據進行了比較。

句子: The hotel room was down the long corridor on the left
中文: 酒店房間在長長的走廊盡頭，位於左側。

句子: She walked down the corridor, looking for her office
中文: 她走過走廊，尋找她的辦公室。

句子: The hospital corridors were bustling with nurses and doctors rushing to attend to patients
中文: 醫院的走廊擁擠不堪，護士和醫生匆忙奔走，照顧病人。

句子: The trade corridor between the two countries facilitates economic exchange
中文: 兩國之間的貿易走廊促進了經濟交流。

句子: The wildlife corridor allows animals to migrate safely between habitats
中文: 野生動物走廊使動物能夠在不同棲息地之間安全遷徙。

句子: The metal pipes corroded over time due to exposure to water and chemicals
中文: 這些金屬管道因長時間暴露於水和化學物質中而生鏽。

句子: The old car had corroded parts that needed replacing
中文: 那輛舊車有些腐蝕的零件需要更換。

句子: The rust on the iron gate indicated that it had corroded from years of exposure to the elements
中文: 鐵門上的鏽蝕顯示它經過多年風雨侵蝕後已經腐蝕。

句子: It's important to regularly clean and protect metal surfaces to prevent them from corroding
中文: 定期清潔和保護金屬表面以防止它們腐蝕是很重要的。

句子: The constant criticism began to corrode her confidence
中文: 持續的批評開始腐蝕她的信心。

句子: The scandal corroded the trust between the politicians and the public
中文: 這起醜聞腐蝕了政治人物與公眾之間的信任。

句子: The metal fence showed signs of corrosion due to exposure to saltwater
中文: 這道金屬圍欄因暴露於鹽水中而顯示出腐蝕的跡象。

句子: Using stainless steel helps reduce the risk of corrosion in marine environments
中文: 使用不鏽鋼有助於減少海洋環境中腐蝕的風險。

句子: She purchased several cosmetic products to prepare for the event
中文: 她購買了幾款化妝品來為活動做準備。

句子: The cosmetic industry has seen significant growth in recent years
中文: 近年來，化妝品行業經歷了顯著的增長。

句子: The changes to the building were primarily cosmetic, improving its appearance without altering its structure
中文: 對建築的改動主要是外觀上的改善，提升了外觀而未改變其結構。

句子: The cosmetic updates to the website made it more visually appealing, but the functionality remained the same
中文: 網站的外觀更新使其更加吸引人，但功能性保持不變。

句子: She applied a cosmetic to her lips before going out
中文: 她在出門前塗抹了唇膏。

句子: The store offers a wide range of cosmetics, including foundations and eyeshadows
中文: 這家店提供各種化妝品，包括粉底和眼影。

句子: After experiencing difficulties adjusting to college life, she sought help from a campus counselor who provided her with coping strategies and emotional support
中文: 在經歷了適應大學生活的困難後，她尋求了校園輔導員的幫助，輔導員為她提供了應對策略和情感支持。

句子: A school counselor helps students with academic, social, and emotional issues
中文: 學校輔導員協助學生處理學業、人際關係及情緒方面的問題。

句子: The counselor at the clinic assisted the family in addressing their child's behavioral challenges and offered strategies to improve communication
中文: 診所的輔導員協助家庭處理孩子的行為問題，並提供改善溝通的策略。

句子: He is crafting a new sculpture
中文: 他正在雕刻一件新的雕塑作品。

句子: The furniture is crafted from bamboo
中文: 這些家具是以竹子精心製作而成的。

句子: She crafted a strategy to boost the company's earnings
中文: 她制定了一項策略來提升公司的收益。

句子: They carefully crafted a plan to improve their company's efficiency
中文: 他們精心制定了一項計劃，以提升公司的效率。

句子: He learned his craft from an old master
中文: 他向一位老匠人學習了他的技藝。

句子: The store sells crafts from around the world
中文: 這家店販售來自世界各地的手工藝品。[=handicrafts]

句子: There's a crafts fair at the school this Saturday
中文: 本週六學校將舉辦一場手工藝品市集。[=an event at which crafts are sold]

句子: The craftsman spent years perfecting his woodworking skills, creating intricate furniture that was both functional and beautiful
中文: 那位工匠花了多年時間磨練他的木工技藝，創作出既實用又美觀的精緻家具。

句子: The jeweler was a true craftsman, designing intricate necklaces that took hours of detailed work
中文: 那位珠寶匠是真正的工匠，設計出精緻的項鍊，這些項鍊需要幾小時的細緻工藝來完成。

句子: The blacksmith, a true craftsman, forged metal into beautiful, durable tools and weapons
中文: 那位鐵匠，真正的工匠，將金屬鍛造為美麗且耐用的工具和武器。

句子: Her pottery was highly sought after, with each piece reflecting the skill and care of a seasoned craftsman
中文: 她的陶藝作品非常搶手，每一件作品都展現了資深工匠的技藝與用心。

句子: The fine craftsmanship of the table is remarkable
中文: 這張桌子精湛的工藝令人讚嘆。

句子: The craftsmanship of the antique furniture was evident in its intricate carvings and sturdy construction
中文: 那件古董家具的工藝顯而易見，精緻的雕刻和堅固的結構展現了其非凡的手工技藝。

句子: "The craftsmanship of the handmade rugs from the region has been passed down through generations
中文: 該地區手工編織地毯的工藝世代相傳，歷久彌新。

句子: He admired the craftsmanship of the watch, noting the delicate engravings and smooth finish
中文: 他欣賞手錶的工藝，注意到精緻的雕刻和光滑的表面處理。

句子: She had to stop running because of a severe cramp in her side
中文: 她因為側腹劇烈抽筋，不得不停下來。

句子: The miserable girl had a craving for sympathy
中文: 那個可憐的女孩渴望得到同情。

句子: His craving for adventure led him to travel around the world
中文: 他對冒險的渴望促使他環遊世界。

句子: After a long day of work, he had a craving for a hot bowl of ramen
中文: 工作一整天後，他渴望來一碗熱騰騰的拉麵。

句子: His craving for success motivated him to work late into the night
中文: 他對成功的渴望激勵他工作到深夜。

句子: She had a craving for chocolate and couldn’t resist buying a bar from the store
中文: 她渴望巧克力，無法抗拒從商店買一塊來滿足自己的慾望。

句子: The baby began to crawl across the floor towards her mother
中文: 嬰兒開始爬過地板，朝著她的母親前進。

句子: The injured animal had to crawl to find safety
中文: 受傷的動物不得不爬行以尋找安全的地方。

句子: The traffic crawled along the highway due to the construction
中文: 由於施工，交通在高速公路上緩慢爬行。

句子: She felt like she was crawling through the long meeting, eager for it to end
中文: 她感覺自己像是在漫長的會議中爬行，迫不及待地希望它結束。

句子: The crawl of the line at the amusement park made them rethink their plans
中文: 遊樂園隊伍的緩慢移動讓他們重新考慮了計劃。

句子: It was a crawl to get through the crowded streets during the festival
中文: 在節日期間穿過擁擠的街道簡直是緩慢爬行。

句子: The thought of a spider crawling on me gives me a crawly feeling
中文: 一想到蜘蛛在我身上爬行，就讓我感到毛骨悚然。

句子: I felt crawly when I saw the bugs scurrying across the floor
中文: 當我看到昆蟲在地板上四處亂竄時，我感到渾身發癢不舒服。

句子: The abandoned house had a crawly atmosphere that made everyone uneasy
中文: 那棄置的房子帶著一種令人不安的詭異氛圍，讓每個人都感到毛骨悚然。

句子: The crawly decorations at the haunted house were enough to frighten the children
中文: 鬼屋裡那些爬行的裝飾足以嚇壞孩子們。

句子: The creation of the new app took months of hard work
中文: (開發這款新應用程式花費了數月的辛勤工作)

句子: The artist’s creation was displayed in the gallery for everyone to admire
中文: (這位藝術家的創作品在畫廊展出，供大家欣賞)

句子: His novel was a brilliant creation that captivated readers worldwide
中文: (他的小說是一部精彩的創作，吸引了全球讀者)

句子: The creation of the new software revolutionized the tech industry
中文: (這款新軟體的創造徹底改變了科技產業)

句子: Many cultures have their own stories about the creation of the world
中文: (許多文化都有關於世界創造的故事)

句子: The scientist studied the creation of stars and galaxies in deep space
中文: (這位科學家研究了深空中恆星和星系的形成)

句子: Art is not just an expression but a creative outlet for the soul’s deepest emotions.
中文: 藝術不僅是一種表達，更是靈魂深處情感的創意出口。

句子: Innovation thrives when people have a creative outlet to explore ideas freely.
中文: 當人們擁有創意出口自由探索想法時，創新才會蓬勃發展。

句子: Writing is a powerful creative outlet that transforms pain into poetry.
中文: 寫作是一種強大的創意出口，能將痛苦轉化為詩歌。

句子: Many people use writing as a creative outlet to express their emotions
中文: (許多人將寫作作為一種創意發洩方式來表達他們的情感)

句子: Music provided him with a creative outlet to share his thoughts and experiences
中文: (音樂為他提供了一種創意發洩方式，讓他能夠分享他的思想和經歷)

句子: Gardening can be a great creative outlet for those who enjoy designing landscapes
中文: (園藝對於喜歡設計景觀的人來說，可以是一個很棒的創意發洩方式)

句子: Painting became her creative outlet, helping her cope with stress
中文: (繪畫成為了她的創意發洩方式，幫助她應對壓力)

句子: The teacher presented her credentials before starting the class
中文: 老師在開始上課前出示了她的資格證明。

句子: Journalists were required to show their credentials to access the event
中文: 記者們必須出示他們的證件才能進入活動現場。

句子: He has impressive credentials in the field of software engineering
中文: 他在軟體工程領域擁有令人印象深刻的資格。

句子: Her credentials as a leader were evident in the success of her team
中文: 她作為領袖的資格在她團隊的成功中展現無遺。

句子: You’ll need to provide your login credentials to access the secure portal
中文: 您需要提供您的登入憑證才能進入安全入口網站。

句子: The organization follows a strict creed of honesty and integrity
中文: 該組織遵循嚴格的誠實與正直信條。

句子: His personal creed is to treat everyone with kindness and respect
中文: 他的個人信條是以善良和尊重對待每個人。

句子: The religious creed emphasizes compassion and faith in a higher power
中文: 這個宗教信條強調同情心和對更高力量的信仰。

句子: Many people live by a moral creed that shapes their decisions and actions
中文: 許多人遵循一套道德信條，這影響著他們的決策和行為。

句子: She tried to creep out of the room without waking anyone up
中文: 她試圖悄悄地離開房間，生怕吵醒任何人。

句子: The dark alley gave her the creeps
中文: 那條黑暗的小巷讓她毛骨悚然。

句子: His strange behavior really gave me the creeps
中文: 他奇怪的行為真讓我毛骨悚然。

句子: The cat crept through the grass, stalking its prey
中文: 那隻貓悄悄地穿過草叢，潛伏著它的獵物。

句子: He crept along the hallway, trying to avoid being heard
中文: 他悄悄地沿著走廊走，試圖不讓人聽見。

句子: A sense of unease began to creep over her as the hours passed
中文: 隨著時間的流逝，一種不安的感覺開始悄悄蔓延到她身上。

句子: The vines crept up the side of the house, covering the walls
中文: 藤蔓悄悄地爬上房子的側面，覆蓋了牆壁。

句子: That guy is a creep; I feel uncomfortable whenever he's around
中文: 那個人真是個怪胎；每當他在附近時，我就感到不自在。

句子: She had to walk home alone and was worried about encountering a creep
中文: 她不得不獨自走回家，擔心會遇到怪人。

句子: There was a slow creep of anxiety as the exam approached
中文: 隨著考試的臨近，焦慮感緩慢地蔓延開來。

句子: The creep of fog through the streets made it difficult to see
中文: 霧氣慢慢地蔓延穿過街道，使得視線變得模糊。

句子: The old abandoned house at the end of the street is really creepy at night
中文: 街尾那棟老舊的廢棄房子在夜晚真的很陰森。

句子: He gave me a creepy look when I walked past him in the hallway
中文: 當我從他身邊走過走廊時，他給了我一個陰森的眼神。

句子: There was a creepy silence in the room after the lights went out
中文: 當燈熄了以後，房間裡陷入了一片陰森的寂靜。

句子: The way the doll’s eyes followed me around the room was downright creepy
中文: 那個娃娃的眼睛一直盯著我走來走去，真是太陰森了。

句子: There was something creepy about the way she smiled, like she was hiding something
中文: 她微笑的方式有些陰森，就像她在隱瞞什麼似的。

句子: The children were fascinated by the creepy crawlies in the garden
中文: 孩子們對花園裡的爬行小生物感到著迷。

句子: She has a fear of creepy crawlies, especially spiders and centipedes
中文: 她對爬行小生物有恐懼，特別是對蜘蛛和蜈蚣。

句子: The kids were scared by the creepy crawly decorations at the haunted house
中文: 孩子們被鬼屋裡那些令人毛骨悚然的爬行裝飾嚇到了。

句子: She shivered at the thought of having a creepy crawly insect crawling up her leg
中文: 她一想到有個令人毛骨悚然的昆蟲爬上她的腿，就不禁打了個冷顫。

句子: The centipede was the creepy-crawliest of them all
中文: 那條蜈蚣是所有昆蟲中最讓人毛骨悚然的。

句子: The sky turned crimson as the sun dipped below the horizon, painting the clouds with fiery hues
中文: 當太陽沉入地平線下，天空變成了深紅色，把雲朵染上了火紅的色調。

句子: The artist used crimson for the highlights in the painting
中文: 這位藝術家在畫作中用深紅色來突顯高光部分。

句子: The crimson leaves of autumn adorned the trees, creating a stunning display of color
中文: 秋天的深紅色葉子點綴著樹木，創造出一幅令人驚艷的色彩畫面。

句子: The crimson of the sunset was reflected in the lake
中文: 夕陽的深紅色倒映在湖面上。

句子: A splash of crimson can turn a quiet painting into a bold statement.
中文: 一抹深紅能讓一幅靜謐的畫作變成大膽的宣言。

句子: She cringed when she saw the spider crawling toward her
中文: 當她看到蜘蛛爬向自己時，她不禁皺起了眉頭。

句子: He cringed at the loud, unexpected noise
中文: 他聽到那聲大而突如其來的噪音時，感到不禁畏縮。

句子: I cringed at my own embarrassing mistake during the speech
中文: 在演講中，我對自己尷尬的錯誤感到不禁羞愧。

句子: She cringed when she heard her old recordings from years ago
中文: 當她聽到多年前的舊錄音時，她不禁感到尷尬。

句子: The employee cringed before his boss, hoping to avoid punishment
中文: 員工在老闆面前感到畏縮，希望能避免受到懲罰。

句子: He cringed and apologized repeatedly to avoid conflict
中文: 他感到畏縮並一再道歉，以避免衝突。

句子: His bad joke caused an awkward cringe from the audience
中文: 他那個糟糕的笑話讓觀眾感到尷尬，大家都不禁皺起了眉頭。

句子: She let out a cringe when she remembered the embarrassing moment
中文: 當她想起那個尷尬的時刻時，不禁發出了一聲畏縮的嘆息。

句子: The fried chicken was golden brown and perfectly crispy on the outside
中文: 炸雞外皮金黃酥脆，內部完美可口。

句子: She likes her bacon crispy, with a crunch in every bite
中文: 她喜歡她的培根煎得酥脆，每一口都有咬勁。

句子: The crispy chips made a satisfying crunch as she bit into them
中文: 當她咬下去時，酥脆的薯片發出了令人滿意的脆響聲。

句子: The leaves crunched beneath our feet, crispy from the cold weather
中文: 在我們腳下，葉子發出嘎吱聲，因為寒冷的天氣變得酥脆。

句子: He enjoyed the crispy sound of the cereal as he poured milk over it
中文: 當他倒牛奶在麥片上時，享受著麥片發出的酥脆聲。

句子: The scholarship committee used several criteria to select the recipients, including academic performance and extracurricular involvement
中文: 獎學金評選委員會使用了多項標準來選擇得獎者，包括學業表現和課外活動參與。

句子: The job candidates were assessed based on criteria such as experience, skills, and cultural fit
中文: 求職者根據經驗、技能和文化契合度等標準進行評估。

句子: High test scores are one criterion used by universities to determine which students to admit
中文: 高分是大學用來決定錄取哪些學生的標準之一。 [=standard]

句子: The project's success was measured against specific criteria, including timeliness and budget adherence
中文: 該項目的成功是根據特定標準來衡量的，包括按時完成和預算遵守。

句子: He is a very famous film critic
中文: (他是一位非常著名的電影評論家)。

句子: She was nervous about presenting her artwork to the critic, knowing that their feedback could greatly influence her career
中文: (她對向評論家展示自己的藝術作品感到緊張，因為她知道他們的反饋可能會對她的職業生涯產生重大影響)。

句子: The actor had to answer many charges from his critics
中文: (這位演員不得不回答來自評論家的許多指控)。

句子: His boss criticized him for his sloppy work habits
中文: 他的老闆批評他工作習慣馬虎。

句子: He was quick to criticize the new policy, arguing that it would create more problems than it would solve
中文: 他迅速批評了新政策，並辯稱這會帶來更多問題而不是解決問題。

句子: The teacher tried not to criticize the students too harshly, instead offering constructive feedback to help them improve
中文: 老師儘量不對學生過於苛刻地批評，而是提供建設性的反饋來幫助他們改進。

句子: Some people criticize the movie for its slow pacing, but others appreciate its deep, thoughtful approach to storytelling
中文: 有些人批評這部電影節奏緩慢，但也有人欣賞它在敘事上深刻而深思熟慮的處理方式。

句子: He asked me to criticize [=critique] his drawings
中文: 他請我評論他的畫作。

句子: The professor’s critique of the student's essay provided valuable insights for improvement
中文: 教授對學生論文的批評提供了寶貴的改進見解。

句子: The art exhibit received a glowing critique from the gallery’s curator
中文: 這個藝術展覽獲得了畫廊館長的高度評價。

句子: They gave a fair and honest critique of her art
中文: 他們對她的藝術作品給予了公正誠實的評論。

句子: The editor was asked to critique the manuscript before it was submitted for publication
中文: 編輯被要求在手稿提交出版前進行評論。

句子: The panel will critique each participant's presentation, offering constructive feedback
中文: 評審小組將對每位參賽者的報告進行評論，並提供建設性的反饋。

句子: She spent her evenings crocheting a cozy blanket for her newborn niece
中文: 她每晚都編織著一條溫暖的毛線毯子，送給她剛出生的侄女。

句子: The local crocheter displayed her beautifully crafted scarves and hats at the artisan market
中文: 當地的鉤針編織師在工藝市場展示了她精美製作的圍巾和帽子。

句子: My grandmother taught me how to crochet, and now I'm making a colorful scarf for winter
中文: 我的祖母教我如何編織，現在我正在為冬天編織一條色彩繽紛的圍巾。

句子: The children were punished in a cruel manner, forced to stand outside in the cold without proper clothing
中文: 孩子們以殘酷的方式受罰，被迫在寒冷的戶外站著，沒有穿適當的衣服。

句子: The death of their beloved son was a cruel blow
中文: 他們摯愛的兒子的去世對他們來說是一個殘酷的打擊。

句子: The weather grew crueler as winter approached, with biting winds and freezing temperatures
中文: 隨著冬季的臨近，天氣變得更加殘酷，刺骨的寒風和凍人的低溫讓人難以忍受。

句子: The cruelest part of the punishment was not the physical pain, but the emotional anguish it caused
中文: 懲罰中最殘酷的部分不是身體上的痛苦，而是它帶來的情感折磨。

句子: The cruelty shown by the dictator towards his people led to widespread suffering
中文: 獨裁者對人民所展示的殘酷行為導致了廣泛的痛苦。

句子: Animal cruelty is a serious offense in many countries, with laws to protect animals from mistreatment
中文: 在許多國家，虐待動物是一種嚴重的犯罪，並且有法律來保護動物免受虐待。

句子: His words were filled with cruelty, intended to hurt her deeply
中文: 他的話語充滿了殘酷，旨在深深傷害她。

句子: The cruelty of the war was evident in the destruction it left behind
中文: 戰爭的殘酷顯而易見於它所留下的破壞。

句子: They booked a vacation on a luxury cruise ship sailing through the Caribbean
中文: 他們預定了一次度假，搭乘豪華郵輪航行穿越加勒比海。

句子: The cruise ship offered a variety of entertainment, including live shows and casinos
中文: 這艘郵輪提供各種娛樂活動，包括現場表演和賭場。

句子: Passengers enjoyed the stunning ocean views from the deck of the cruise ship
中文: 乘客們在郵輪的甲板上欣賞到壯麗的海洋景色。

句子: The cruise ship made a stop at several tropical islands during its journey
中文: 郵輪在航程中停靠了幾個熱帶島嶼。

句子: She crumbed the bread before feeding it to the birds
中文: 她先把麵包搓成碎屑，然後才餵給鳥兒吃。

句子: Under the intense questioning, his resolve began to crumb, and he confessed
中文: 在激烈的質問下，他的決心開始崩解，於是他坦白了。

句子: He brushed the crumbs off his shirt after eating the cookie
中文: 他吃完餅乾後，把碎屑從襯衫上刷掉。

句子: She didn't give a crumb about his opinion
中文: 她對他的意見一點也不在乎。

句子: She realized he was just giving her crumbs of attention, never fully committing to anything serious
中文: 她意識到他只是給她一點點關注，從未真正投入任何認真的東西。

句子: He gave me a few crumbs of information about the writer
中文: 他給了我一些關於那位作家的小道消息。

句子: The old building began to crumble under the weight of neglect and decay
中文: 那座老建築在忽視和腐朽的重壓下開始崩塌。

句子: She crumbled an empty snail shell in her fingers
中文: 她用手指捏碎了一個空的蝸牛殼。

句子: In the end, the Roman Empire crumbled
中文: 最終，羅馬帝國崩潰了。

句子: Under the intense scrutiny, his confident demeanor started to crumble, revealing his insecurities
中文: 在嚴密的審視下，他自信的舉止開始瓦解，暴露出內心的不安與不安感。

句子: She baked a delicious apple crumble for dessert, topped with a scoop of vanilla ice cream
中文: 她烤了一道美味的蘋果酥作為甜點，上面加了一球香草冰淇淋。

句子: The crunchy apples were a refreshing snack on a hot day
中文: 這些脆脆的蘋果是炎熱天氣中的一個清爽小吃。

句子: The chips were so crunchy that they made a loud sound as I ate them
中文: 薯片脆得讓我吃的時候發出了很大的聲音。

句子: She loves crunchy granola mixed with yogurt for breakfast
中文: 她早餐喜歡吃脆脆的格蘭諾拉麥片配優格。

句子: She has a crush on her classmate and gets nervous around him
中文: 她對她的同班同學有好感，並且在他面前會感到緊張。

句子: The storm crushed the hopes of the outdoor event organizers
中文: 暴風雨摧毀了戶外活動主辦方的希望。

句子: Many teenagers experience their first crush during middle school
中文: 許多青少年在中學時期經歷他們的初戀。

句子: His crush on the famous actor was evident when he collected all her movies
中文: 他對那位著名演員的迷戀顯而易見，因為他收集了她的所有電影。

句子: After meeting the author, she developed a crush on his passion for writing
中文: 在見到這位作者後，她對他對寫作的熱情產生了崇拜之情。

句子: Outside the hotel stood a crush of reporters waiting for her arrival
中文: 酒店外站著一群擁擠的記者在等待她的到來。

句子: She crushed the can before tossing it into the recycling bin
中文: 她在把罐子丟進回收桶之前將它壓扁。

句子: Unfortunately, some of the flowers got crushed when we were moving them
中文: 不幸的是，當我們搬動花朵時，有些花被壓壞了。

句子: Crush the nuts and sprinkle them on top of the cake
中文: 把堅果壓碎，然後撒在蛋糕上面。

句子: The team crushed their opponents in the championship game
中文: 隊伍在冠軍賽中徹底擊敗了對手。

句子: She cut off the crusts of the sandwich for her child
中文: 她為孩子切掉了三明治的邊邊。

句子: The pizza had a crispy, golden crust
中文: 這個披薩有著酥脆的金黃色外皮。

句子: You can order pizza with a thin or thick crust, depending on your preference
中文: 你可以根據個人口味選擇薄皮或厚皮披薩。

句子: The Earth's crust is made up of tectonic plates that are constantly moving
中文: 地球的地殼由不斷移動的板塊構成。

句子: Scientists study the Earth's crust to learn more about its structure and history
中文: 科學家研究地球的地殼，以了解更多關於其結構和歷史的資訊。

句子: After the volcano erupted, a thick crust of cooled lava formed on the surface
中文: 火山爆發後，厚厚的冷卻熔岩層在地表形成。

句子: A crust of snow covered the ground after the cold night
中文: 寒冷的夜晚過後，地面覆蓋了一層雪殼。

句子: She enrolled in a culinary school to learn advanced cooking techniques
中文: 她報名參加了烹飪學校，以學習高級烹飪技巧。

句子: The restaurant is known for its culinary excellence and innovative dishes
中文: 這家餐廳以其卓越的烹飪技藝和創新菜餚聞名。

句子: He has a culinary passion for creating unique desserts that surprise his guests
中文: 他對創造獨特的甜點充滿烹飪熱情，總是能讓客人驚喜。

句子: Many culinary traditions around the world influence each other through globalization
中文: 全球化使得世界各地的許多烹飪傳統相互影響。

句子: The cunning thief outsmarted the police by disguising himself as a delivery man
中文: 那個狡猾的小偷通過偽裝成送貨員，成功智勝了警方。

句子: She had a cunning plan to win the competition without anyone noticing
中文: 她有一個狡猾的計劃，想在不被任何人察覺的情況下贏得比賽。

句子: His cunning tactics in business made him a successful entrepreneur, but at the cost of others' trust
中文: 他在商業上的狡猾手段使他成為了一位成功的企業家，但也以失去他人信任為代價。

句子: The artist created a cunning piece of jewelry with intricate patterns
中文: 這位藝術家創作了一件狡猾的珠寶，擁有複雜的圖案。

句子: The watch was a cunning piece of engineering, with tiny gears that worked flawlessly
中文: 這只手錶是一件精巧的工程作品，擁有運作無懈可擊的小齒輪。

句子: His cunning helped him rise to power, but it left many enemies in his wake
中文: 他的狡猾幫助他崛起到權力的巔峰，但也讓他在背後留下了許多敵人。

句子: The fox is often depicted in folklore as a symbol of cunning
中文: 狐狸在民間傳說中常被描繪為狡猾的象徵。

句子: The inventor's cunning allowed him to create groundbreaking technology
中文: 這位發明家的狡猾使他能夠創造出開創性的技術。

句子: She curated a selection of paintings for the museum's new exhibit
中文: (她為博物館的新展覽策劃了一系列畫作。)

句子: The website curates articles from various sources to keep readers informed
中文: (該網站精選來自各個來源的文章，以確保讀者獲取最新資訊。)

句子: He curated his social media profile to reflect his artistic style
中文: (他精心整理了自己的社群媒體檔案，以展現其藝術風格。)

句子: The fashion designer curated a unique wardrobe for the photo shoot
中文: (這位時尚設計師為照片拍攝精心挑選了一套獨特的服裝。)

句子: The editor curated a list of the top novels of the year for readers
中文: (這位編輯為讀者精心策劃了一份年度最佳小說名單。)

句子: The curate led the morning prayer services
中文: (這位助理牧師主持了晨禱儀式。)

句子: The curator of the museum spent months researching and organizing the new exhibit on ancient Egyptian artifacts
中文: (博物館的策展人花了幾個月的時間研究和整理有關古埃及文物的新展覽)。

句子: As a curator at the art gallery, she is responsible for acquiring new works and planning upcoming exhibitions
中文: (作為藝術畫廊的策展人，她負責收購新作品和規劃即將舉辦的展覽)。

句子: The library curator is preparing a special collection of rare manuscripts to be displayed next month
中文: (圖書館策展人正在準備一個特別的稀有手稿收藏，將於下個月展出)。

句子: After the divorce, the mother was granted custody of the children
中文: 離婚後，母親獲得了孩子的監護權。

句子: The child was placed in the custody of social services after the incident
中文: 事件發生後，孩子被交給社會服務部門監護。

句子: The company retained custody of the documents until the investigation was completed
中文: 公司在調查完成之前保留了文件的監管權。

句子: He was taken into police custody after the arrest
中文: 他在被逮捕後被帶入警察拘留所。

句子: The suspect is still in custody and will appear in court next week
中文: 嫌疑人仍在拘留中，將於下週出庭。

句子: The company’s cutting-edge technology has revolutionized the industry
中文: (該公司的尖端技術顛覆了整個產業。)

句子: He presented a cutting-edge design for the new stroller that incorporates smart features
中文: (他提出了一款最先進的新型嬰兒車設計，融入了智能功能。)

句子: The cutting-edge software is capable of processing data faster than ever before
中文: (這款最先進的軟體能夠以前所未有的速度處理數據。)

句子: He's a director who tries to keep his films right on the cutting edge
中文: (他是一位導演，努力讓自己的電影始終走在時代的最前沿。)

句子: The engineer calculated the volume of the cylinder using its radius and height
中文: 工程師使用圓柱的半徑和高度計算了它的體積。

句子: The gas tank is shaped like a cylinder for better storage and handling
中文: 汽油箱呈圓柱形，以便於更好的儲存和處理。

句子: The pipes in the building are cylindrical, allowing smooth water flow
中文: 大樓中的管道呈圓柱形，這樣可以讓水流更加順暢。

句子: The car's engine has several cylinders that drive the pistons
中文: 汽車的引擎有幾個圓柱形的汽缸，用來驅動活塞。

句子: The hydraulic cylinder is used to lift heavy loads in construction machinery
中文: 液壓缸用於建築機械中，以提升重物。

句子: The lamp has a cylindrical base that fits perfectly in the corner
中文: 這盞燈有一個圓柱形的底座，能完美地放在角落裡。

句子: The building's design includes several cylindrical columns supporting the roof
中文: 該建築的設計包括多根圓柱形立柱來支撐屋頂。

句子: The engineers chose a cylindrical shape for the container to optimize space and strength
中文: 工程師選擇圓柱形容器，以優化空間和強度。

句子: The damp in the basement caused the wooden furniture to warp
中文: 地下室的潮濕使得木製家具變形。

句子: He wiped off the damp from the window with a cloth
中文: 他用布擦去窗戶上的潮濕。

句子: The clothes felt damp after being left out in the cool air
中文: 衣服在涼爽的空氣中晾了一會兒後，變得有些潮濕。

句子: The damp ground made it difficult to set up the tent
中文: 潮濕的地面使得搭帳篷變得困難。

句子: The rain damped their enthusiasm for the outdoor event
中文: 雨水減弱了他們對戶外活動的熱情。

句子: She damped the cloth to clean the dusty surface
中文: 她弄濕了布料來清潔塵土飛揚的表面。

句子: The noise from the party was damped by the thick walls of the building
中文: 派對的噪音被大樓厚重的牆壁隔絕了。

句子: The keys dangled from her fingers as she walked
中文: 她走路時，鑰匙從她手指間晃蕩著。

句子: A necklace dangled from her neck, catching the sunlight
中文: 一條項鍊從她脖子上垂下來，映著陽光閃閃發亮。

句子: The curtain dangled from the rod, loosely hanging to the floor
中文: 窗簾從桿子上垂下來，鬆散地掛到地板上。

句子: The promise of a bonus dangled before the employees, motivating them to work harder
中文: 獎金的承諾在員工面前晃蕩，激勵他們更加努力工作。

句子: She dangled the idea of a vacation in front of her children, but they didn't know when it would happen
中文: 她在她孩子面前提起了度假的想法，但他們不知道什麼時候會實現。

句子: The negotiations deadlocked when both parties refused to budge on their demands
中文: 當雙方都不肯在各自的要求上讓步時，談判陷入了僵局。

句子: The two teams deadlocked in a scoreless match
中文: 兩支隊伍在沒有得分的比賽中陷入僵局。

句子: Her home run deadlocked the game at 3–3
中文: 她的一記全壘打讓比賽以3比3陷入僵局。

句子: The board meeting ended in a deadlock, with no decision reached on the proposed merger
中文: 董事會會議以僵局告終，對於提議的合併案未能達成任何決定。

句子: Today's meeting with the supervisor regarding employee workload ended in a deadlock
中文: 今天與主管關於員工工作量的會議以僵局結束。

句子: After the storm, debris from fallen trees covered the streets
中文: 暴風雨過後，倒下的樹木殘骸覆蓋了街道。

句子: The explosion left debris scattered across the entire area
中文: 爆炸後，殘骸散落在整個區域。

句子: Workers cleared the construction debris from the site
中文: 工人們清理了工地上的建築殘骸。

句子: The actress made her film debut at the age of sixteen
中文: 這位女演員在十六歲時首次參與電影演出。

句子: His debut as a conductor was highly praised by critics
中文: 他作為指揮家的首次亮相受到評論家的高度讚揚。

句子: The new smartphone will have its debut next month
中文: 這款新智慧型手機將於下個月首次亮相。

句子: The singer debuted her new song on live television
中文: 這位歌手在電視直播中首次演唱了她的新歌。

句子: The product debuted to great fanfare at the tech conference
中文: 這款產品在科技大會上隆重亮相。

句子: He debuted as a professional basketball player last season
中文: 他在上個賽季首次以職業籃球員的身份亮相。

句子: Your debut isn’t just your first step—it’s your statement to the world.
中文: 出道不只是第一步，而是你向世界宣告自己的時刻。

句子: A strong debut shows promise, but staying great takes dedication.
中文: 強勢的初登場展現潛力，而持續卓越則需要奉獻。

句子: Style isn’t about trends—it’s about making a timeless debut.
中文: 風格不是追隨潮流，而是創造永恆的初印象。

句子: The dentist warned him about tooth decay caused by too much sugar
中文: 牙醫警告他，過多的糖分會導致牙齒蛀壞。

句子: The old house showed signs of decay, with crumbling walls and broken windows
中文: 那座老房子顯示出衰敗的跡象，牆壁崩塌，窗戶破裂。

句子: The decay of moral values in society was a concern for many
中文: 社會道德價值的衰退令許多人感到擔憂。

句子: The once-great empire fell into decay over the centuries
中文: 那個曾經偉大的帝國在幾個世紀裡陷入了衰亡。

句子: The fallen leaves began to decay on the forest floor
中文: 落葉開始在森林地面上腐爛。

句子: If food is left out for too long, it will start to decay
中文: 如果食物被放置太久，就會開始腐壞。

句子: His memory started to decay with age
中文: 隨著年齡增長，他的記憶開始衰退。

句子: Without proper maintenance, the building will quickly decay
中文: 如果沒有適當的維護，這棟建築很快就會衰敗。

句子: The con artist's deceit was exposed when his lies were uncovered by authorities
中文: 當騙子的謊言被當局揭穿時，他的欺騙行為暴露了出來。

句子: Her deceit in the business deal caused a major loss of trust
中文: 她在商業交易中的欺騙行為造成了信任的重大損失。

句子: He used deceit to gain access to confidential information
中文: 他使用欺騙手段獲取機密信息。

句子: She deceived him into believing that she was wealthy
中文: 她欺騙他，讓他相信她很富有。

句子: The company was accused of deceiving customers with false advertising
中文: 該公司被指控通過虛假廣告欺騙顧客。

句子: He tried to deceive his parents about where he had been
中文: 他試圖欺騙父母，隱瞞自己去哪裡了。

句子: Don’t be deceived by appearances; the situation is more complicated than it looks
中文: 不要被表象所欺騙；這個情況比看起來更複雜。

句子: It is easier to deceive others than to convince them they have been deceived.
中文: 欺騙他人容易，要讓他們相信自己被騙才難。

句子: Those who control the truth often deceive without ever uttering a lie.
中文: 控制真相的人，往往能在不說謊的情況下進行欺騙。

句子: As they approached the intersection, the driver began to decelerate, preparing to stop at the red light
中文: 當他們接近十字路口時，司機開始減速，準備在紅燈前停下來。

句子: Experts predict that economic growth will decelerate
中文: 專家預測經濟增長將會放緩。

句子: He was admired for his decency and honesty in all his dealings
中文: 他因在所有交易中的正直與誠實而受到欽佩。

句子: Despite the heated debate, they maintained a level of decency toward each other
中文: 儘管辯論激烈，他們仍然對彼此保持一定程度的禮貌。

句子: If you're going to be late, please have the decency to call and let me know
中文: 如果你會遲到，請有禮貌地打電話通知我。

句子: These deceptions cost them dear
中文: 這些欺騙讓他們付出了慘重的代價。

句子: After years of trusting their financial advisor, they discovered that he had been involved in fraudulent schemes
中文: 經過多年信任他們的財務顧問後，他們發現他一直參與詐騙計劃。

句子: Sheila's decisive leadership style enabled the team to swiftly navigate through challenges and achieve their goals with precision and efficiency
中文: Sheila 果斷的領導風格使團隊能夠迅速應對挑戰，並以精確和高效的方式實現目標。

句子: In photography, capturing a decisive moment often requires both skill and intuition, freezing a fleeting instant in time that tells a powerful story
中文: 在攝影中，捕捉決定性瞬間通常需要技巧和直覺，將轉瞬即逝的時刻凝固，講述一個震撼人心的故事。

句子: The president’s declaration of the new policy changes was broadcast nationwide
中文: 總統宣佈新政策變動的消息已在全國廣播。

句子: Her declaration of intent to run for office gathered a lot of media attention
中文: 她宣布有意參選的聲明引起了大量媒體關注。

句子: His declaration of innocence convinced the jury to consider his case carefully
中文: 他聲明自己無辜的話語說服了陪審團仔細考慮他的案件。

句子: The company's declaration about its environmental efforts was well-received by the community
中文: 該公司關於其環保努力的聲明受到社區的好評。

句子: The Declaration of Independence is one of the most important documents in American history
中文: 《獨立宣言》是美國歷史上最重要的文件之一。

句子: The court required a signed declaration of assets from the defendant
中文: 法院要求被告提供簽署的財產聲明。

句子: The living room's decor was modern, with sleek furniture and neutral tones
中文: (客廳的裝潢現代時尚，配有流線型家具和中性色調。)

句子: The living room's decor was modern, with sleek furniture and neutral tones
中文: 客廳的裝潢是現代風格，配有線條流暢的傢俱和中性色調。你想我幫你翻譯更多類似句子嗎？

句子: She spent hours perfecting the decor for her wedding, choosing elegant flowers and vintage decorations
中文: (她花了數小時精心布置婚禮裝飾，選擇優雅的花卉和復古裝飾品。)

句子: She spent hours perfecting the decor for her wedding, choosing elegant flowers and vintage decorations
中文: 她花了好幾個小時來完善婚禮的布置，精心挑選優雅的花卉和復古的裝飾品。你需要我幫你整理這些句子的主題分類嗎？

句子: The restaurant’s decor had an industrial feel, with exposed brick walls and metal furniture
中文: (這家餐廳的裝飾帶有工業風格，具有裸露的磚牆和金屬家具。)

句子: The restaurant’s decor had an industrial feel, with exposed brick walls and metal furniture
中文: 這家餐廳的裝潢帶有工業風格，牆面裸露的紅磚搭配金屬家具。你想繼續蒐集與「decor」相關的句子嗎？

句子: Thoughtful décor isn’t about luxury—it’s about creating a space that tells your story.
中文: 用心的裝飾不在於奢華，而在於營造出講述你故事的空間。

句子: Elegance begins with simplicity, even in the décor.
中文: 優雅始於簡約，連居家裝飾亦是如此。

句子: She performed a heroic deed by saving the child from the burning building
中文: 她通過將孩子從燃燒的建築中救出，完成了一項英雄壯舉。

句子: His good deeds in the community earned him the respect of his peers
中文: 他在社區中的善行贏得了同儕的尊重。

句子: The thief was caught after committing several criminal deeds
中文: 那名小偷在犯下幾起罪行後被抓獲。

句子: The house was officially transferred to him through a deed of sale
中文: 這棟房子通過一份銷售契約正式轉讓給了他。

句子: The lawyer presented the deed as proof of ownership of the land
中文: 律師將契約呈交作為土地所有權的證明。

句子: The board deemed the proposal beneficial for the company’s future
中文: 董事會認為該提案對公司未來有利。

句子: She was deemed qualified for the position after a thorough review
中文: 經過徹底審查後，她被認為符合該職位的資格。

句子: The project was deemed successful based on the positive feedback
中文: 根據正面的反饋，該項目被認為是成功的。

句子: The responsibility has been deemed too burdensome for one person to handle
中文: 這項責任已被認為對一個人來說過於沉重，無法承擔。

句子: The building was deemed [=considered, judged] unsafe after the fire
中文: 這座建築在火災後被認為（= 被視為、判定為）不安全。

句子: He deemed that it was his duty to help the needy
中文: 他認為幫助有需要的人是他的責任。

句子: The company went into default on its loan
中文: 該公司未能履行其貸款義務。

句子: He was sued for defaulting on his rent payments
中文: 他因未支付租金而被起訴。

句子: The default setting on the computer was set to automatic updates
中文: 電腦的預設設定為自動更新。

句子: The default font in the document is Times New Roman
中文: 文件中的預設字型是 Times New Roman。

句子: No one else wanted the job, so he became the club's president by default
中文: 沒有人願意接這份工作，所以他自動成為了俱樂部的會長。

句子: We won the game by default when the other team failed to show up
中文: 當對方隊伍未能出現時，我們自動贏得了比賽。

句子: If you default on your mortgage, you could lose your home
中文: 如果你未能償還房貸，可能會失去你的家。

句子: After the power outage, the system defaulted to its original settings
中文: 停電後，系統自動恢復到原始設定。

句子: The player defaulted in the tournament because of her injury
中文: 該名選手因為受傷而在比賽中棄權。

句子: He defrauded them of their money
中文: 他詐騙了他們的錢。

句子: Using deft strokes of the brush, the artist created a masterpiece that captured the essence of the sunset
中文: 藝術家用巧妙的畫筆 strokes 創作了一幅捕捉日落精髓的傑作。

句子: She deftly navigated through the crowded streets, weaving between pedestrians with graceful ease
中文: 她熟練地穿梭在擁擠的街道上，輕盈地在人群中穿行。

句子: The company's management employed a delaying tactic by promising to address employee concerns in the next quarterly meeting, effectively postponing any immediate action on the matter
中文: 公司的管理層採取了一種拖延戰術，承諾在下一次的季度會議上處理員工的疑慮，藉此有效地延後了對此事的即時行動。

句子: The politician employed a delaying tactic by requesting additional time to review the proposed legislation, knowing that it would buy them more time to gather support from undecided colleagues
中文: 這位政治人物採取了拖延戰術，要求更多時間來審查所提議的法案，心知這樣可以爭取更多時間，來爭取尚未表態的同僚支持。

句子: She handled the delicate china teacup with great care
中文: 她非常小心地拿著那只精緻的瓷茶杯。

句子: The delicate aroma of the flowers filled the room
中文: 花朵細緻的香氣瀰漫整個房間。

句子: The doctor gave delicate advice on how to manage the patient's condition
中文: 醫生給出了細緻的建議，說明如何處理病人的病情。

句子: He made a delicate remark to avoid offending anyone
中文: 他做出了一個委婉的評論，以避免冒犯任何人。

句子: Despite the stressful situation, her calm and composed demeanor helped reassure everyone around her
中文: 儘管情況壓力重重，她冷靜沉著的舉止讓周圍的每個人都感到安心。

句子: I dislike his pompous demeanor
中文: 我不喜歡他那自以為是的態度。

句子: She had a shy demeanor that made her seem approachable and humble
中文: 她有著害羞的舉止，讓她看起來平易近人且謙遜。

句子: His friendly demeanor made everyone feel at ease during the meeting
中文: 他友善的舉止讓大家在會議中都感到輕鬆自在。

句子: In the city center, buildings are densely packed, creating a bustling urban environment
中文: 在市中心，建築物密集地排列著，營造出一個繁忙熱鬧的都市環境。

句子: Her speech was densely packed with information, leaving the audience impressed but overwhelmed
中文: 她的演講內容資訊非常密集，讓觀眾印象深刻但也感到有些不堪負荷。

句子: The town square was densely crowded with people enjoying the festival
中文: 鎮上的廣場擠滿了人群，大家都在享受節日的歡樂氣氛。

句子: The forest was densely populated with tall trees and thick undergrowth
中文: 這片森林密布著高大的樹木和茂密的灌木叢。

句子: Her departure from the company surprised her colleagues
中文: 她離開公司讓同事們感到驚訝。

句子: The train's departure is scheduled for 9:00 AM
中文: 火車的開車時間定於早上9點。

句子: His sudden departure from the event raised many questions
中文: 他突然離開活動引起了許多疑問。

句子: The artist's new style was a departure from his earlier, more traditional work
中文: 這位藝術家的新風格與他早期更傳統的作品有所不同。

句子: The policy marked a departure from previous government approaches
中文: 這項政策標誌著與以往政府做法的不同。

句子: This innovative design represents a significant departure from conventional architecture
中文: 這個創新的設計代表了對傳統建築的重大突破。

句子: The airport announced the departure of Flight 303
中文: 機場公告了303航班的起飛。

句子: We all gathered at the gate to bid him farewell before his departure
中文: 在他離開之前，我們都聚集在門口為他送行。

句子: The departure of the cruise ship was delayed due to weather conditions
中文: 由於天氣狀況，郵輪的起航被延遲。

句子: His enemies depict [=portray] him as a cruel and dangerous leader
中文: 他的敵人將他描繪成一位殘忍而危險的領袖。

句子: The book depicts him as a rather unpleasant character
中文: 這本書將他描繪成一個相當令人不快的角色。

句子: The travel brochure depicts the idyllic beaches and charming coastal towns of the Mediterranean region, inviting tourists to experience its beauty firsthand
中文: 旅遊手冊描繪了地中海地區那如畫般的海灘和迷人的海濱小鎮，邀請遊客親身體驗其美麗。

句子: The artist's depiction of the historical event in her painting captured the emotions and atmosphere of the moment
中文: 這位藝術家在畫作中對歷史事件的描繪，捕捉了當時的情感和氛圍。

句子: The storyteller's vivid depiction (also description) of the ancient battle transported the audience back in time, as they could almost hear the clash of swords and the roar of warriors
中文: 故事講述者生動的描繪（也可稱為描述）將觀眾帶回了古代戰鬥的時光，彷彿他們能聽到劍鋒相交的聲音和戰士們的怒吼。

句子: Overfishing can deplete fish populations, threatening their survival
中文: 過度捕撈可能會耗盡魚類數量，威脅其生存。

句子: Activities such as logging and mining deplete our natural resources
中文: 伐木和採礦等活動會耗盡我們的自然資源。

句子: We completely depleted our life savings when we bought our new house
中文: 我們在購買新房時完全耗盡了畢生積蓄。

句子: The word "biology" is derived from the Greek words for "life" and "study
中文: 「生物學」一詞源自於希臘語中「生命」和「學習」的詞彙。

句子: She derived great satisfaction from her work in the community
中文: 她從自己在社區中的工作中獲得了極大的滿足感。

句子: The design of this chair derives inspiration from mid-century modern aesthetics
中文: 這把椅子的設計汲取了中世紀現代美學的靈感。

句子: My name is derived from an ancient language meaning "brave warrior
中文: 我的名字源自一種古老的語言，意思是「勇敢的戰士」。

句子: We can derive that it will rain tomorrow because the sky is very cloudy
中文: 我們可以推斷明天會下雨，因為天空雲層密布。

句子: She derived the answer to the math problem by using a formula she learned in class
中文: 她通過使用課堂上學到的公式，得出了這道數學題的答案。

句子: The plane began to descend as it approached the airport
中文: 當飛機接近機場時，它開始下降。

句子: He is descended from Confucius
中文: 他是孔子的後裔。

句子: The family estate will descend to the eldest son
中文: 家族的財產將傳給長子。

句子: The custom has descended to our day
中文: 這個習俗一直延續到今天。

句子: Recent evidence supports the theory that birds descended from dinosaurs
中文: 最近的證據支持了鳥類源自恐龍的理論。

句子: The soldiers descended on the enemy camp at dawn
中文: 士兵們在黎明時分突襲了敵人的營地。

句子: Bob and his girl friend descended on us for the weekend
中文: 鮑勃和他的女朋友突然來找我們度過週末。

句子: In autumn [=fall], thousands of students descend upon [=visit] our town
中文: 在秋天，成千上萬的學生湧入我們的城鎮。

句子: Silence descended upon the crowd
中文: 寂靜降臨在人群中。

句子: Bob and his girlfriend descended on us for the weekend
中文: 鮑勃和他的女朋友週末突然來訪我們家。

句子: Wait for the elevator to descend
中文: 等待電梯下降。

句子: You can ride the escalator up but have to descend on foot
中文: 你可以乘坐扶手電梯向上，但必須步行下來。

句子: Descending the mountain was even more dangerous than climbing [=ascending] it
中文: 下山比爬山更危險。

句子: The children descended the staircase silently
中文: 孩子們悄悄地下樓梯。

句子: The cat slowly descended from the tree after being stuck for hours
中文: 貓咪在被困了幾個小時後，慢慢地從樹上爬了下來。

句子: After his wife died, he descended [=sank] into a deep depression
中文: 在妻子去世後，他陷入了深深的抑鬱。

句子: As the evening wore on, the party descended into chaos
中文: 隨著夜晚的推移，派對陷入了混亂。

句子: She descends from a long line of artists
中文: 她出身於一個藝術世家。

句子: Many people in this area are descendants of German immigrants
中文: 這個地區的許多人是德國移民的後代。

句子: Recent evidence supports the theory that birds are the modern descendants of dinosaurs
中文: 最近的證據支持了鳥類是恐龍現代後代的理論。

句子: The royal family can trace its descendants back hundreds of years
中文: 皇室家族可以追溯到數百年前的後代。

句子: Modern languages like French and Spanish are descendants of Latin
中文: 像法語和西班牙語這樣的現代語言是拉丁語的後代。

句子: Today’s smartphones are descendants of the early mobile phones
中文: 今天的智能手機是早期移動電話的後代。

句子: The company's new software is a descendant of its first-generation product
中文: 該公司新軟體是其第一代產品的後代。

句子: The airplane began its gradual descent toward the airport
中文: （飛機開始向機場進行逐漸下降。）

句子: The hikers struggled during the steep descent from the mountain
中文: （登山者在從山頂的陡峭下降過程中掙扎。）

句子: His career took a sudden descent after the scandal
中文: （他的職業生涯在醜聞後突然下滑。）

句子: She is of French descent and speaks the language fluently
中文: （她有法國血統，並且流利地講法語。）

句子: Many people in the region can trace their descent back to ancient tribes
中文: （該地區的許多人可以追溯他們的血統到古代部落。）

句子: His descent from a noble family was well-documented
中文: （他來自一個貴族家庭的血統有著充分的文獻記錄。）

句子: The descent of the enemy troops caught them off guard
中文: （敵軍的下坡進攻讓他們措手不及。）

句子: The town prepared for the sudden descent of tourists during the festival
中文: （城鎮為節日期間突如其來的遊客湧入做好了準備。）

句子: After months of searching for a job with no success, she was growing desperate for a source of income
中文: 經過幾個月的求職但始終未能成功，她開始對找到收入來源感到絕望。

句子: Her desperate attempts to please everyone only led to disappointment and exhaustion
中文: 她為取悅每個人的絕望嘗試只帶來了失望和疲憊。

句子: In his desperate attempt to escape, he jumped from the moving train
中文: 在他絕望的逃脫嘗試中，他從行駛中的火車上跳了下來。

句子: A desperate man will stop at nothing to get what he wants
中文: 一個絕望的人會不擇手段地得到他想要的東西。

句子: He was desperate for companionship after spending months alone in the wilderness
中文: 在荒野中獨自度過了幾個月後，他渴望得到陪伴。

句子: He was desperate for work to provide for a large family
中文: 他迫切需要工作來養活一個大家庭。

句子: She searched desperately for her lost keys, knowing she would be late if she couldn't find them soon
中文: 她絕望地尋找著丟失的鑰匙，知道如果不能很快找到它們，她就會遲到。

句子: He pleaded desperately with the airline agent to find him another flight after discovering his original one was canceled
中文: 在發現原本的航班被取消後，他絕望地向航空公司代理人懇求，要求幫他找另一班航班。

句子: The man in the river desperately tried to reach the side.
中文: 河中的那名男子絕望地試圖游向岸邊。

句子: Despite the rain, we went for a walk in the park
中文: 儘管下著雨，我們還是去公園散步了。

句子: Even though it was raining, we went for a walk in the park
中文: 儘管在下雨，我們還是去公園散步了。

句子: She went out for a walk, though it was raining
中文: 雖然下著雨，她還是出去散步了。

句子: Although it was raining, we went for a walk in the park
中文: 雖然在下雨，我們還是去公園散步了。

句子: This money is destined for a new house
中文: 這筆錢注定用來購買新房子。

句子: The room was destined to become a nursery for the new baby
中文: 這個房間注定成為新生嬰兒的嬰兒房。

句子: The couple believed they were destined to be together
中文: 這對夫婦相信他們注定要在一起。

句子: He spoke about the tragedy with surprising detachment
中文: 他以出乎意料的冷漠談論這場悲劇。

句子: Emotional detachment can sometimes be a coping mechanism during stressful situations
中文: 情感上的冷漠有時候可以是應對壓力情況的應對機制。

句子: The detachment of the upper frame allowed the stroller to convert into a cart
中文: 上框架的分離使得這款推車能夠轉換成手推車。

句子: The detachment of the painting from the wall required careful handling
中文: 將畫作從牆上取下需要小心處理。

句子: A military detachment was sent to assist with disaster relief efforts
中文: 一支軍事分隊被派遣協助災後救援工作。

句子: The small detachment patrolled the remote area regularly
中文: 這支小型分隊定期巡邏偏遠地區。

句子: Without proper maintenance, the building will gradually deteriorate
中文: 如果沒有適當的維護，這棟建築將會逐漸惡化。

句子: Exposure to rain and sun will gradually deteriorate the paint
中文: 長時間曝露在雨水和陽光下會使油漆逐漸劣化。

句子: Her health began to deteriorate after she stopped taking her medication
中文: 在她停止服藥後，她的健康開始惡化。

句子: The relationship deteriorated due to constant misunderstandings and lack of communication
中文: 由於不斷的誤解和缺乏溝通，這段關係逐漸惡化。

句子: Economic conditions deteriorated rapidly during the financial crisis
中文: 經濟情況在金融危機期間迅速惡化。

句子: The old building showed clear signs of deterioration due to neglect
中文: 這座舊建築因疏忽而顯示出明顯的劣化跡象。

句子: His health has been in steady deterioration over the past year
中文: 他的健康在過去一年中一直在穩定惡化。

句子: The economic deterioration led to widespread unemployment
中文: 經濟衰退導致了廣泛的失業。

句子: The deterioration of air quality in the city has become a major concern
中文: 城市空氣質量的惡化已成為一個重大關注問題。

句子: The minor flaws in the painting did not detract from its overall beauty
中文: 畫作中的些許瑕疵並未減損其整體之美。

句子: The loud noise from the construction site detracts from the beauty of the park
中文: 施工現場的噪音削弱了公園的美感。

句子: Her minor mistakes did not detract from the overall excellence of her performance
中文: 她些許的錯誤並未減損她整體表現的卓越。

句子: The flashy design of the website detracts from its usability
中文: 網站華而不實的設計削弱了其可用性。

句子: The scandal will not detract from his fame
中文: 這場醜聞不會減損他的名聲。

句子: The neighborhood residents were concerned about the presence of deviant behavior, leading to calls for increased police patrols
中文: 社區居民對不良行為的存在感到擔憂，並因此呼籲加強警察巡邏。

句子: The artist's unconventional approach to painting was celebrated by some but considered deviant by traditionalists
中文: 這位藝術家對繪畫的非傳統方式受到一些人的讚賞，但對傳統主義者來說則被視為偏離常規。

句子: The company's financial report showed several deviant trends compared to industry benchmarks, raising questions about its performance
中文: 該公司的財務報告顯示出與行業基準相比的幾個異常趨勢，引發了對其表現的質疑。

句子: The anthropologist observed cultural practices that were considered deviant by outsiders but held deep significance within the community
中文: 人類學家觀察到一些外人視為異常的文化習俗，但這些習俗在社區內具有深遠的意義。

句子: The documentary explores various deviant sexual practices, shedding light on alternative lifestyles and challenging societal norms regarding intimacy and relationships
中文: 這部紀錄片探討了各種被視為偏離常規的性行為，揭示了替代性生活方式並挑戰了社會對親密關係和人際關係的規範。

句子: It's important to remember that just because someone engages in deviant behavior doesn't mean they're a bad person; there may be underlying factors we don't understand
中文: 重要的是要記住，僅僅因為某人從事偏離常規的行為並不代表他們是壞人；背後可能有我們無法理解的原因。

句子: The community was shocked to learn that one of their neighbors had been labeled a deviant by the authorities, as he always seemed so friendly and normal
中文: 社區居民得知他們的一位鄰居被當局標籤為異常人物時感到震驚，因為他總是看起來如此友好和正常。

句子: The project deviated from its original plan due to unforeseen circumstances
中文: 由於不可預見的情況，該項目偏離了原計劃。

句子: The politician's statements seemed to deviate from his party's official stance on the issue
中文: 那位政治家的言論似乎偏離了他所在政黨在該問題上的官方立場。

句子: The company implemented measures to prevent deviate practices in its supply chain
中文: 公司採取了措施來防止供應鏈中出現偏離常規的行為。

句子: The psychologist studied the mind of a deviate to understand the underlying causes of criminal behavior
中文: 心理學家研究了一位偏離常規者的思維，以了解犯罪行為背後的根本原因。

句子: The student's behavior showed a clear deviation from the school's code of conduct, prompting a meeting with the principal
中文: 學生的行為明顯偏離了學校的行為準則，促使與校長召開會議。

句子: The airplane encountered strong winds, causing it to make a slight deviation from its planned flight path
中文: 飛機遇到強風，導致航道輕微偏離預定航線。

句子: The company's profits for the quarter showed a deviation from the industry average, raising concerns among shareholders
中文: 公司本季度的利潤與行業平均水平有所偏差，引發了股東們的擔憂。

句子: The quality control team identified a deviation in the product specifications, leading to adjustments in the manufacturing process
中文: 質量控制團隊發現產品規格的偏差，並對製造過程進行了調整。

句子: The employee's consistent tardiness was viewed as a deviation from company policy, resulting in disciplinary action
中文: 員工一再遲到被視為偏離公司政策，並因此受到紀律處分。

句子: The devious salesman manipulated his customers into buying unnecessary products
中文: 那位狡猾的推銷員操控顧客購買不必要的產品。

句子: Instead of confronting the issue directly, she took a devious approach by spreading rumors about her rival
中文: 她沒有直接面對問題，而是採取了狡猾的方式，散播關於競爭對手的謠言。

句子: He took a devious route through the back alleys and side streets to avoid the heavy traffic on the main roads during rush hour
中文: 他選擇了穿過後巷和側街的狡猾路線，避開了高峰時段主要道路上的擁堵交通。

句子: His devious plan to sabotage his competitor’s business was finally exposed
中文: 他那個破壞競爭對手生意的狡詐計劃終於曝光了。

句子: The team worked together to devise a new marketing strategy to attract customers to their product
中文: 團隊合作設計了一個新的行銷策略，旨在吸引顧客購買他們的產品。

句子: She devised an innovative way to reduce waste in the office, improving the company’s sustainability efforts
中文: 她設計了一種創新的方法來減少辦公室的浪費，改善公司的可持續發展努力。

句子: To solve the impossible, you must first devise what others dare not imagine.
中文: 要解決不可能的問題，首先得設計出他人不敢想像的方案。

句子: They devised a plan to improve the neighborhood park, making it more accessible to children and families
中文: 他們設計了一個計劃來改善社區公園，使其對兒童和家庭更具可達性。

句子: The pianist’s dexterity allowed her to play complex pieces effortlessly
中文: 鋼琴家的靈巧使她能輕鬆地彈奏複雜的曲目。

句子: He showed great dexterity in tying the intricate knots
中文: 他在綁複雜的結時展現了極高的靈巧。

句子: The surgeon’s dexterity was evident as he performed the delicate operation
中文: 外科醫生的靈巧在他進行精細手術時展現得淋漓盡致。

句子: Her dexterity in managing multiple tasks at once made her a highly valued team member
中文: 她在同時處理多項任務的靈活性使她成為團隊中極具價值的成員。

句子: His mental dexterity helped him navigate through the tricky negotiations with ease
中文: 他的心智能力幫助他輕鬆應對棘手的談判。

句子: He was diagnosed with type 1 diabetes at a young age and requires insulin injections daily
中文: 他在年輕時被診斷為1型糖尿病，並且每天需要注射胰島素。

句子: Living with type 1 diabetes means being strong, disciplined, and always prepared—but it never means giving up.
中文: 與第一型糖尿病共處代表著堅強、自律與時刻準備，但絕不代表放棄。

句子: Many people with type 2 diabetes can manage their condition through diet and exercise
中文: 許多2型糖尿病患者可以通過飲食和運動來管理他們的病情。

句子: The doctor advised her to lose weight to help control her type 2 diabetes
中文: 醫生建議她減輕體重，以幫助控制她的2型糖尿病。

句子: Draw a diagonal line to divide the square into two triangles
中文: 畫一條對角線將正方形分成兩個三角形

句子: The carpenter measured the diagonal of the square to ensure that it was perfectly aligned
中文: 畫一條對角線將正方形分成兩個三角形

句子: The carpenter measured the length of the diagonal
中文: 木匠測量了對角線的長度

句子: The dictator ruled the country with an iron fist, punishing anyone who opposed him
中文: "獨裁者以鐵腕統治國家，懲罰任何反對他的人。"

句子: Many dictators have used propaganda to maintain their hold on power
中文: "許多獨裁者利用宣傳來維持對權力的控制。"

句子: The dictator's regime was marked by widespread human rights violations
中文: "該獨裁者的政權以廣泛的人權侵犯為特徵。"

句子: She gave a dignified speech at the ceremony
中文: "她在典禮上發表了莊重的演講。"

句子: In his new uniform, he looked handsome and carried himself with a dignified way of walking
中文: "穿著新制服，他看起來英俊，走路的姿態也顯得莊重。"

句子: The dignified manner in which he handled the situation impressed his colleagues
中文: "他處理這個情況的莊重方式給同事們留下了深刻的印象。"

句子: The teacher dignified each student's question, making them feel valued
中文: "老師尊重每個學生的問題，讓他們感到被重視。"

句子: She dignified her speech with a sense of calm and authority
中文: "她以冷靜和權威的態度使她的演講顯得更具莊重。"

句子: His actions dignified the occasion, adding a sense of solemnity
中文: "他的行為使這個場合更顯莊重，增添了一份莊嚴感。"

句子: He didn’t want to dignify the rumor with a response
中文: "他不想用回應來抬高這個謠言的地位。"

句子: By responding to the insult, she felt she was dignifying it unnecessarily
中文: "通過回應侮辱，她覺得自己不必要地抬高了它。"

句子: The artist refused to dignify the criticism, knowing it wasn’t worth acknowledging
中文: "藝術家拒絕對批評做出回應，知道這並不值得去理會。"

句子: His dignity was evident in the way he handled the difficult situation without losing his composure
中文: "他的尊嚴在於他處理困難情況的方式，始終保持冷靜。"

句子: She spoke with dignity, despite the challenges she faced
中文: "儘管面臨挑戰，她仍然以尊嚴發言。"

句子: The dignity of the occasion was reflected in the respectful behavior of the guests
中文: "這個場合的尊嚴體現在賓客們的尊重行為中。"

句子: The elderly man carried himself with great dignity throughout his life
中文: "那位老人一生都以極大的尊嚴自處。"

句子: The community showed dignity and respect for the fallen heroes
中文: "社區對逝去的英雄表現出尊嚴和敬意。"

句子: He regained his dignity after overcoming the hardships
中文: "他克服困難後重獲尊嚴。"

句子: You need to dilute the paint with water before using it
中文: "在使用之前，你需要將油漆用水稀釋。"

句子: The doctor advised her to dilute the medication with juice for easier consumption
中文: "醫生建議她將藥物與果汁混合，以便更容易服用。"

句子: The new regulations may dilute the impact of the original policy
中文: "新規定可能會削弱原政策的影響。"

句子: The hiring of the new CEO diluted the power of the company's president
中文: "新 CEO 的聘用削弱了公司總裁的權力。"

句子: Diluting the quality of our products could harm our brand reputation
中文: "稀釋我們產品的質量可能會損害我們的品牌聲譽。"

句子: The laboratory prepared a dilute solution for the experiment
中文: "實驗室為實驗準備了一種稀釋溶液。"

句子: The dilute mixture was easy to spread over the surface
中文: "這種稀釋混合物容易塗抹在表面上。"

句子: He dimmed the lights in the room to create a cozy atmosphere
中文: 他調暗了房間的燈光，營造出一種舒適的氛圍。

句子: He dimmed the lights in the theater before the movie started
中文: 在電影開始之前，他把劇院的燈光調暗了。

句子: The dim light in the room made it difficult to read
中文: 房間裡昏暗的光線讓閱讀變得困難。

句子: His memory of the event was dim after so many years
中文: 經過這麼多年，他對那件事的記憶變得模糊了。

句子: Her chances of success seemed dim after the recent setbacks
中文: 經過最近的挫折後，她的成功機會似乎渺茫。

句子: Carbon dioxide (CO₂) is released when fossil fuels are burned
中文: "當化石燃料燃燒時，二氧化碳（CO₂）會被釋放出來。"

句子: Nitrogen dioxide (NO₂) is a pollutant that contributes to smog formation
中文: "二氧化氮（NO₂）是一種污染物，會促進煙霧的形成。"

句子: The production of dioxide gases in industrial processes needs to be carefully regulated to prevent environmental damage
中文: "工業過程中二氧化物氣體的產生需要嚴格監管，以防止環境損害。"

句子: The hurricane had disastrous effects on the coastal town, leaving thousands homeless
中文: 颶風對沿海小鎮造成了災難性的影響，讓數千人無家可歸。

句子: The company’s disastrous decision led to the loss of many jobs
中文: 公司的災難性決策導致了許多工作崗位的流失。

句子: His disastrous mistake during the presentation cost the team the deal
中文: 他在報告中的災難性錯誤讓團隊失去了這筆交易。

句子: The teacher took disciplinary action against the student for breaking the school rules
中文: 老師對違反校規的學生採取了紀律處分。

句子: The company has a disciplinary procedure for employees who violate policies
中文: 公司對違反政策的員工有紀律處分程序。

句子: The disciplinary committee reviewed the case and decided to suspend the employee
中文: 紀律委員會審查了此案並決定暫停該員工的職位。

句子: The accountant found a discrepancy in the financial statements that needed to be addressed
中文: 會計發現財務報表中有不一致之處，需要加以處理。

句子: There was a discrepancy between the reported and actual sales figures
中文: 報告的銷售數字與實際銷售數字之間存在不一致。

句子: There were discrepancies between their accounts of the accident
中文: 他們對事故的敘述存在不一致之處。

句子: The detective noticed a discrepancy in the witness’s statements
中文: 偵探注意到目擊者的陳述中存在不一致之處。

句子: The study revealed a discrepancy between the expected outcomes and the actual results
中文: 研究顯示預期結果與實際結果之間存在差異。

句子: The engineer reported a discrepancy in the measurements of the prototype
中文: 工程師報告了原型測量數據中的不一致。

句子: He wore a disguise to avoid being recognized by fans
中文: 他戴上偽裝以避免被粉絲認出。

句子: Her clever disguise made it difficult for anyone to recognize her at the party
中文: 她巧妙的偽裝讓任何人在派對上都很難認出她。

句子: The spy disguised himself as a delivery person to gain entry to the building
中文: 那名間諜把自己偽裝成送貨員，以便進入大樓。

句子: She tried to disguise her disappointment with a smile
中文: 她試圖用微笑掩飾自己的失望。

句子: He disguised his handwriting to keep his identity secret
中文: 他偽裝了自己的字跡以保護身份不被揭露。

句子: The plane would probably disintegrate at that high speed
中文: 飛機在那麼高的速度下可能會解體。

句子: The neglected bridge began to disintegrate, with pieces of concrete falling into the river below
中文: 被忽視的橋樑開始解體，混凝土塊掉入下方的河流中。

句子: The company decided to dismiss the employee due to repeated violations of company policy
中文: 公司決定解雇該員工，因為他多次違反公司政策。

句子: The manager dismissed the worker after several warnings about tardiness
中文: 經過多次對遲到的警告後，經理開除了那位員工。

句子: She dismissed his concerns as minor and not worth worrying about
中文: 她把他的擔憂當作小事，覺得不值得擔心。

句子: The committee dismissed the proposal after finding it lacked practical feasibility
中文: 委員會認為該提案缺乏實際可行性，因此予以駁回。

句子: The judge dismissed the case for lack of evidence
中文: 法官因證據不足而駁回了此案。

句子: The professor dismissed the class after the lecture was over
中文: 教授在講課結束後宣布下課。

句子: The judge dismissed the court session until the following week
中文: 法官宣布休庭，延至下週再開庭。

句子: The company faced backlash after the wrongful dismissal of several employees
中文: 公司在錯誤解雇多名員工後遭遇了強烈反彈。

句子: He appealed the decision after receiving a dismissal notice from his employer
中文: 在收到雇主的解雇通知後，他對該決定提出了上訴。

句子: His suggestions were met with immediate dismissal by the committee
中文: 他的建議立即遭到委員會的駁回。

句子: The judge ruled in favor of the dismissal of the case due to lack of evidence
中文: 法官因證據不足裁定撤銷此案。

句子: I was surprised by his dismissal of the idea
中文: 我對他駁回這個想法感到驚訝。

句子: The strong winds displaced the picnic table across the yard
中文: 強風把野餐桌吹到院子的另一邊。

句子: After the merger, the company's headquarters were displaced to a larger office downtown
中文: 合併之後，公司的總部被遷移到市中心一間更大的辦公室。

句子: The new technology displaced the old way of communicating
中文: 新科技取代了舊有的溝通方式。

句子: AI technologies may displace people's jobs in the future
中文: 人工智慧技術未來可能會取代人們的工作。

句子: The young actor displaced the veteran star as the lead role in the play
中文: 這位年輕演員取代了資深明星，成為了劇中的主角。

句子: The construction project displaced several families from their homes
中文: 這個建設項目將幾個家庭迫遷出他們的家園。

句子: The wildfire displaced many animals from their habitats
中文: 野火將許多動物從它們的棲息地驅逐了出去。

句子: The displaced furniture cluttered the living room after the renovation
中文: 翻新後，移動的家具堆滿了客廳。

句子: Many displaced families sought shelter in temporary camps after the earthquake
中文: 地震後，許多流離失所的家庭在臨時營地尋求庇護。

句子: Displaced wildlife often struggle to adapt to new environments
中文: 流離失所的野生動物常常難以適應新環境。

句子: The displeasing smell of rotten food filled the kitchen
中文: (腐爛食物令人不悅的氣味充滿了整個廚房。)

句子: His displeasing attitude made it hard for others to enjoy the meeting
中文: (他令人不悅的態度讓其他人很難享受這次會議。)

句子: The displeasing color of the walls made the room feel smaller
中文: (牆壁令人不悅的顏色讓房間感覺更小。)

句子: The artist’s use of harsh contrasts created a displeasing effect
中文: (藝術家對強烈對比的運用產生了令人不悅的效果。)

句子: The dispute between the two companies over the contract terms was resolved in court
中文: 兩家公司關於合約條款的爭議在法庭上得到了解決。

句子: There was a heated dispute among the team members about the project's direction
中文: 團隊成員之間就專案方向展開了激烈的爭論。

句子: The territorial dispute between the neighboring countries has been ongoing for decades
中文: 鄰國之間的領土爭議已經持續了數十年。

句子: The labor dispute between the union and management led to a strike
中文: 工會與管理層之間的勞資爭議導致了罷工。

句子: They disputed the results of the survey, claiming it was inaccurate
中文: 他們對調查結果提出爭議，聲稱結果不準確。

句子: The couple disputed where to spend the holiday
中文: 這對夫妻爭論著該去哪裡度假。

句子: The defendant disputed the charges brought against them in court
中文: 被告在法庭上對所提出的指控提出異議。

句子: She disputed the accuracy of the report and requested a revision
中文: 她對報告的準確性提出異議並要求修訂。

句子: They disputed the election results
中文: 他們對選舉結果提出異議。

句子: The storm caused a severe disruption in electricity supply
中文: 暴風雨嚴重中斷了電力供應。

句子: Construction work led to a disruption in traffic flow during peak hours
中文: 施工導致尖峰時段交通流量中斷。

句子: The company faced significant disruptions in production due to equipment failure
中文: 由於設備故障，公司生產遭遇了重大中斷。

句子: The rise of streaming services caused a disruption in the traditional cable TV industry
中文: 串流服務的興起對傳統有線電視產業造成了衝擊。

句子: Smartphones have created a disruption in how people communicate and access information
中文: 智慧型手機徹底改變了人們溝通和獲取資訊的方式。

句子: The startup’s innovative business model led to a disruption in the retail sector
中文: 這家新創公司的創新商業模式對零售業造成了顛覆。

句子: Sugar dissolves quickly in hot water
中文: 糖在熱水中很快溶解。

句子: She stirred the tea until the honey dissolved completely
中文: 她攪拌茶水，直到蜂蜜完全溶解。

句子: The company was dissolved after years of financial struggles
中文: 該公司在多年的財務困境後被解散。

句子: The board voted to dissolve the committee after it completed its work
中文: 董事會在委員會完成工作後投票決定解散該委員會。

句子: The audience dissolved into tears during the play's final scene
中文: 在劇本的最後一幕中，觀眾忍不住淚流滿面。

句子: The children dissolved into laughter during the funny part of the movie
中文: 在電影的搞笑片段中，孩子們忍不住笑了起來。

句子: The distant view of the mountains was breathtaking as the sun set behind them
中文: (遠處的群山景色隨著夕陽西下而令人驚嘆。)

句子: From the hill, we had a distant view of the entire valley
中文: (從山丘上，我們可以遠望整個山谷。)

句子: The whiskey is distilled to achieve a smooth flavor
中文: 威士忌經過蒸餾處理，以達到順口的風味。

句子: They distilled the seawater to produce drinkable water
中文: 他們將海水進行蒸餾處理，製造出可飲用的水。

句子: She distilled the complex report into a few clear points for the team
中文: 她將複雜的報告精煉成幾個簡明的要點，提供給團隊。

句子: The novel distills the essence of life in a small town
中文: 這部小說提煉了小鎮生活的精髓。

句子: There is a clear distinction between classical music and jazz
中文: 古典音樂與爵士音樂之間有明顯的區別。

句子: The distinction between a hobby and a career is important for personal growth
中文: 區分興趣與職業對個人成長非常重要。

句子: She received the distinction of being named the best student of the year
中文: 她獲得了被評為年度最佳學生的殊榮。

句子: The company earned the distinction of having the best customer service in the industry
中文: 該公司獲得了擁有業界最佳客戶服務的殊榮。

句子: His ability to make distinctions between similar ideas helped clarify the discussion
中文: 他能夠區分相似觀點的能力幫助澄清了討論。

句子: The distinction between fact and opinion is crucial for critical thinking
中文: 事實與觀點之間的區別對於批判性思維至關重要。

句子: The constant noise outside was a major distraction while studying
中文: 外面不斷的噪音在學習時成為了主要的干擾。

句子: Social media can be a significant distraction during work hours
中文: 社交媒體在工作時間內可能是個重大的干擾源。

句子: He complained that there were not enough distractions in the town
中文: 他抱怨鎮上沒有足夠的娛樂活動。

句子: He struggled to concentrate due to his distraction over personal issues
